translated: but he should not be feared by him,

original: seng ge'i gzugs kyis rnam par rgyu //
analyzed: seng ge'i gzugs kyis rnam par rgyu //
translated: because he moves about in the form of a lion.

original: zhes pa'i don ni go sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don ni go sla ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this is easy to understand.

original: yang na brgya byin gyi sgra ni brgya byin thugs rdo rje mchog gi dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor las so //
analyzed: yang na brgya byin gyi sgra ni brgya byin thugs rdo rje mchog gi dbang phyug gi rnal 'byor las so //
translated: Or else, the word Indra is from the yoga of Indra, the supreme lord of the vajra mind.

original: de lta bu ni mnyam pa ste yul dang dbang po dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni mnyam pa ste yul dang dbang po dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Such is the equality, the non-duality of object and sense faculty.

original: de lta bur gyur pa yang gang de lha min ni lha ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa yang gang de lha min ni lha ma yin no //
translated: And such is the asura, the non-god.

original: dbang phyug med cing dbyer med pa nyid kyis bsdu ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug med cing dbyer med pa nyid kyis bsdu ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Because of the absence of a lord and non-duality, he has the nature of the aggregate.

original: de yang mdun ni dang po ste /
analyzed: de yang mdun ni dang po ste /
translated: And that is in front, at the beginning.

original: dang por stong ba'i byang chub ste //
analyzed: dang por stong ba'i byang chub ste //
translated: First, the enlightenment of emptiness.

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: With these words.

original: de nyid nges par ni de phung po ma lus par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid nges par ni de phung po ma lus par gyur pa'o //
translated: That very thing is ascertained as the state of no remainder of the aggregates.

original: brgya byin lta bu ni spro bar byed pa'i bdag nyid srid par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brgya byin lta bu ni spro bar byed pa'i bdag nyid srid par gyur pa'o //
translated: Like Indra, one becomes the lord of the desire realm.

original: de la zhes pa ni de lta bur gyur na'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni de lta bur gyur na'o //
translated: There, in that state,

original: 'jigs par mi bya ba ni sgra bsgrag par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs par mi bya ba ni sgra bsgrag par mi bya ba'o //
translated: one should not be afraid, that is, one should not be frightened.

original: seng ge'i gzugs kyis ni ji ltar seng ge 'jigs pa med par rgyu ba de bzhin du yang kun la dogs pa dang bral bar rgyu zhing kun la khyab par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i gzugs kyis ni ji ltar seng ge 'jigs pa med par rgyu ba de bzhin du yang kun la dogs pa dang bral bar rgyu zhing kun la khyab par gyur pa'o //
translated: With the form of a lion, just as a lion moves about without fear, so one moves about free from all doubts, pervading everything.

original: kun la dogs pa med pa des gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa nyams pa'i rtog par gyur pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: kun la dogs pa med pa des gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa nyams pa'i rtog par gyur pa de gsungs pa /
translated: That one, free from all doubts, has the idea of the decline of the practice of the benefit of others.

original: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings,

original: rtag tu snying rjes btung bar bya //
analyzed: rtag tu snying rjes btung bar bya //
translated: one should always be drunk with compassion.

original: rnal 'byor btung dga' rnal 'byor ba //
analyzed: rnal 'byor btung dga' rnal 'byor ba //
translated: The yogi who is drunk with yoga

original: gzhan gyi btung bas bzi ba med //
analyzed: gzhan gyi btung bas bzi ba med //
translated: is not intoxicated by the drink of others.

original: ces pa smos te /
analyzed: ces pa smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: snying rjes ni sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las gdon par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pa des so //
analyzed: snying rjes ni sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las gdon par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pa des so //
translated: The yogi who, out of compassion, desires to save from suffering and the causes of suffering,

original: btung ba ni bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: btung ba ni bsrung ba'o //
translated: drinks the drink,

original: rtag tu ni rgyun ma chad par sems can kun gyi don du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni rgyun ma chad par sems can kun gyi don du'o //
translated: always, without interruption, for the sake of all beings.

original: de nyid 'di ni rnal 'byor btung dga' ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'di ni rnal 'byor btung dga' ste /
translated: This very thing is the yogi's delight in drinking.

original: rnal 'byor ni bsrung ba'i rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni bsrung ba'i rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: Yoga is the attachment to the protection.

original: de nyid rnal 'byor pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That very thing is called yoga.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi btung bas ni gzhan gyi ro'i rjes su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi btung bas ni gzhan gyi ro'i rjes su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the drinking of another is the transformation into the taste of another.

original: de'i bzi ba med ni dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bzi ba med ni dga' ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of intoxication is the absence of delight.

original: yang na snying rje ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na snying rje ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Or else, compassion is the conventional truth.

original: de 'thung ba ni gnyis su med pa'i rtog pas don dam pa'i bden pa de thob pa'o //
analyzed: de 'thung ba ni gnyis su med pa'i rtog pas don dam pa'i bden pa de thob pa'o //
translated: Drinking that is the attainment of that ultimate truth by nondual realization.

original: rtag tu ni rgyun ma chad par ro //
analyzed: rtag tu ni rgyun ma chad par ro //
translated: Always is without interruption.

original: ji ltar zhe na sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir ro //
translated: How? For the sake of all beings.

original: sems can yang de yin la thams cad kyang de yin pas na sems can thams cad de gzugs la sogs @69b pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can yang de yin la thams cad kyang de yin pas na sems can thams cad de gzugs la sogs @69b pa'i phung po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: And since they are all sentient beings, all sentient beings are the nature of the aggregates of form, etc.

original: de nyid kyi don ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi don ni don dam pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is the ultimate.

original: rgyu 'dis ni rgyu 'di na'o //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis ni rgyu 'di na'o //
translated: By this cause, this is the cause.

original: de nyid rnal 'byor btung dga' ste gnyi ga dbyer med par rtog pa bsdu ba'i rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnal 'byor btung dga' ste gnyi ga dbyer med par rtog pa bsdu ba'i rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: That itself is the delight of the yogi, the passion of the union of the two, the non-dual realization.

original: de lta bur gyur ba'i de rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba'i de rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: The yogi who has become such is endowed with reality.

original: de nyid 'di'i gzhan gyi btung bas ni gzhan ni zla bo med pa'i gcig go //
analyzed: de nyid 'di'i gzhan gyi btung bas ni gzhan ni zla bo med pa'i gcig go //
translated: This is his other drink, the one without another, the single one.

original: de'i btung ba ni 'khril zhing gnyis su med par rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i btung ba ni 'khril zhing gnyis su med par rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: His drink is non-conceptual, entwined and non-dual realization.

original: bzi ba med ni dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bzi ba med ni dga' ba med pa'o //
translated: Without intoxication is without joy.

original: thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mngon par byang chub par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mngon par byang chub par bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the manifest enlightenment of omniscience, the nature of the completely pure dharmadhatu.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs dgyes pa'i rdo rje las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs dgyes pa'i rdo rje las /
translated: The mandala of the nine deities of the body, speech, and mind of all the tathagatas, which is the Hevajra tantra,

original: spyod pa'i rim par phye ba drug pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i rim par phye ba drug pa'o //
translated: is the sixth chapter of the stage of practice.

original: thams cad ni kun la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ni kun la khyab pa'i phyir ro //

original: drug pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: drug pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lnga'o //

original: sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje gsum mo //

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rje ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs dgyes pa'i rdo rje gnyi ga dbyer med pa dgu'i dkyil 'khor ro //

original: spyod pa zhes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa zhes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med par rgyu ba'o //
translated: Practice is the movement of the inseparability of the relative and the ultimate.

original: de'i rim par phye ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rim par phye ba ni /
translated: The stage of that is

original: gsang ba rab tu gsal bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba rab tu gsal bar ston pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the clear elucidation of the secret.

original: de nyid drug pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid drug pa ste /

original: drug pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: drug pa rdzogs pa'o //

analyzed: dgyes pa rdo rje'i rnam par bshad pa rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor las /

original: spyod pa'i rim par phye ba ste le'u drug pa'o /
analyzed: spyod pa'i rim par phye ba ste le'u drug pa'o /
translated: the section on the stage of practice.üîΩThe great mudra and so forth were taught in brief.üîΩThe great mudra is explained extensively in the section on the stage of practice.

translated: After that, the practitioner of yoga who is practicing in an unspecified place,

analyzed: de nas 'di de dang lhan cig tu tshogs pa med pas 'khrugs par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: pa de'i tshe /

original: 'di ni mnyes par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'di ni mnyes par 'gyur ro /
translated: this is the pleasing.

analyzed: de nas de dang lhan cig tu tshogs pas dngos grub nges par thob pa yin pa de gsungs pa /

analyzed: de nas tstsho ma'i le'u bshad par bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: Now, the chapter on the cumbƒ´ will be explained.

analyzed: de'i rim par phye ba bshad par bya'o // gang gis spun dang srong mor yang //
translated: Its division will be explained.üîΩBy which, one should know without doubt

analyzed: the tshom med par shes par bya //

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /

original: thabs ltar shes rab po //
analyzed: thabs ltar shes rab po //

original: brda nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: brda nyid gsungs pa /

original: gang zhig sor mo gcig ston pa //
analyzed: gang zhig sor mo gcig ston pa //

original: zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes pa smos te /

translated: A and ƒÅ are the avadh≈´ti.

original: de'i mthil ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i mthil ni rang bzhin no //

analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore:

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug mgon po nyid //üîΩ'dis ni gzhan gyi brjod mi bya //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug mgon po nyid // 'dis ni gzhan gyi brjod mi bya //
translated: The lord of the ten stages is the protector himself.

original: zhes pa la //
analyzed: zhes pa la //
translated: This is not to be expressed by others.

original: 'di nyid kyis phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkha' 'gro ma rnam par dag pas sa bcu'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang mkha' 'gro ma rnam par dag pas sa bcu'i dbang phyug go //
translated: By this very [verse], he is the Lord of the Ten Stages, because of the purity of the Tathagata, who is of the nature of the five aggregates, and of the dakinis.

original: de nyid mgon po ste /
analyzed: de nyid mgon po ste /
translated: He is the Protector,

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi bla ma'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i phyir ma ning du yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi bla ma'i rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i phyir ma ning du yang bstan to //
translated: because of the non-duality of the nature of the Guru of the three worlds. He is also taught to be the Neuter.

original: n'ad dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi bya bas zung du 'jug ba thob pa yin no //
analyzed: n'ad dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi bya bas zung du 'jug ba thob pa yin no //
translated: By the action of the nature of the conjunction of na and da, he has attained the state of union.

original: slar yang @75b gzhan tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyis ma yin par dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin 'dis mkha' 'gro ma dang de bzhin gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: slar yang @75b gzhan tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyis ma yin par dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin 'dis mkha' 'gro ma dang de bzhin gshegs pa yin no //
translated: Again, by this nature of inseparability, which is not of a different nature from the other, he is the dakini and the Tathagata.

original: yang na sa bcu'i dbang phyug ni /
analyzed: yang na sa bcu'i dbang phyug ni /
translated: Or else, the Lord of the Ten Stages,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin 'di rnams nyid kyis gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rang bzhin 'di rnams nyid kyis gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: by these very natures of the Bodhisattvas Kshitigarbha and so forth, who are the purities of the eye and so forth, he is taught to be the dwelling places, such as the sacred grounds and neighboring sacred grounds, and so forth.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not another.

original: mgon po ni slar yang 'gro ba'i bla ma sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mgon po ni slar yang 'gro ba'i bla ma sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Lord is the Buddha, the Guru of the world, again.

original: gzhan gyis bcu gcig pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bcu gcig pa bstan to //
translated: The other is the eleventh.

original: mgon po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The Lord is the Vajra-Holder.

original: gzhan gyis zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'brel pas bcu gnyis pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'brel pas bcu gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: The other is the twelfth, in connection with Vajrasattva.

original: 'dis ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi byang chub sems dpa' dang sa bcu gcig gi dbang phyug sangs rgyas dang / sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug rdo rje 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi byang chub sems dpa' dang sa bcu gcig gi dbang phyug sangs rgyas dang / sa bcu gnyis kyi dbang phyug rdo rje 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: By this, the Bodhisattva who is the Lord of the tenth stage, the Buddha who is the Lord of the eleventh stage, and the Vajra-Holder who is the Lord of the twelfth stage are indicated.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga rnam par dag pas bcu tham pa dang / gnyi gas bskyed pa'i ye shes bcu gcig dang / ye shes myong ba'i mtshan nyid bcu gnyis pa de bsnan pa rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga dang gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga rnam par dag pas bcu tham pa dang / gnyi gas bskyed pa'i ye shes bcu gcig dang / ye shes myong ba'i mtshan nyid bcu gnyis pa de bsnan pa rdo rje 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The ten are the five sense-organs such as the eye, and the five sense-objects such as form, the eleventh is the intuition generated by both, and the twelfth is the intuition of the experience of that, which is added, and is the Vajra-Holder.

original: yang na / sa bcu dbang phyug mgon po nyid //
analyzed: yang na / sa bcu dbang phyug mgon po nyid //
translated: Or else, the Lord is the one who is the Lord of the ten stages.

original: ces pa la mgon po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa he ru ka'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa la mgon po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa he ru ka'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The Lord is the Vajra-Holder in the form of Heruka.

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug ni /
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug ni /
translated: The lords of the ten stages are the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di rnams nyid kyis gnas la sogs pa'i gnas sa bcu'i rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: 'di rnams nyid kyis gnas la sogs pa'i gnas sa bcu'i rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: These are the ten stages, such as Joyous, etc.

original: cis khyad par 'phags shen /
analyzed: cis khyad par 'phags shen /
translated: How are they distinguished?

original: gnas gzhan tha dad pa ma yin pas sa bcur bzhugs pa kho na'i gnas gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gnas gzhan tha dad pa ma yin pas sa bcur bzhugs pa kho na'i gnas gnyis yin no //
translated: They are the two abodes of the ten stages, because they are not different from the other abodes.

original: sa bcu gnyis pa tha mi dad pas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa'i gnas bcu gnyis po rnams kyi bcu gnyis nyid sa bcu'o //üîΩde la rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / 'od byed pa dang / spyad dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
analyzed: sa bcu gnyis pa tha mi dad pas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa'i gnas bcu gnyis po rnams kyi bcu gnyis nyid sa bcu'o // de la rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / 'od byed pa dang / spyad dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
translated: The twelve stages, such as Joyous, etc., are the twelve stages because they are not different from the twelfth stage.

original: chos kyi sprin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin no //
translated: They are the Joyous, the Stainless, the Radiant, the Brilliant, the Immovably Heroic, the Gone Afar, the Immovable, the Excellent Wisdom, the Cloud of Dharma, the Tathagata.

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes ji ltar 'di la brjod ce na /
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba zhes ji ltar 'di la brjod ce na /
translated: Why is the first stage called Joyous?

original: 'go ba'i don byed pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes brnyes nas phyag rgya chen po'i dga' ba dang bde ba thob pas na rab tu dga' ba zhes brjod do //üîΩchags pa la sogs @76a * //
analyzed: 'go ba'i don byed pa dang / rjes su 'brel pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes brnyes nas phyag rgya chen po'i dga' ba dang bde ba thob pas na rab tu dga' ba zhes brjod do // chags pa la sogs @76a * //
translated: It is called the Joyous because, having attained the supramundane wisdom that is the cause of the beginning of the path and the joy and bliss of the great seal, one is filled with joy.

original: pa'i tshul khrims 'chal ba'i dri ma kun dang bral nas dri ma med pa thob pas dri ma med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: pa'i tshul khrims 'chal ba'i dri ma kun dang bral nas dri ma med pa thob pas dri ma med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the Stainless because, having become free from all the stains of immorality such as desire, one attains the stainless state.

original: ye shes kyi snang ba tshad mi shes pa'i bud shing bsreg pa'i rang bzhin des 'od 'phro ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang ba tshad mi shes pa'i bud shing bsreg pa'i rang bzhin des 'od 'phro ba zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the Radiant because, with the light of wisdom that is the nature of the fire that burns the immeasurable fuel of the afflictions, one radiates light.

original: de rnams nyid byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom pas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i dbang bsgyur ba thob pas sbyang dka' ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de rnams nyid byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom pas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i dbang bsgyur ba thob pas sbyang dka' ba zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called Difficult to Overcome because, by cultivating the factors of enlightenment, one attains mastery over the afflictions.

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i 'du byed mngon du byed pa bsgom zhing mtshan ma sna tshogs yid la byed pa med par sa mngon du gyur pa thob pas mngon du gyur pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i 'du byed mngon du byed pa bsgom zhing mtshan ma sna tshogs yid la byed pa med par sa mngon du gyur pa thob pas mngon du gyur pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called the stage of direct presence because one has attained the stage of direct presence, which is the cultivation of the actualizing formative forces, without the mental attention of various signs.üîΩ

original: rtag tu mtshan ma yid la byed pa las ring du zhugs par dbang thob pas na ring du song ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rtag tu mtshan ma yid la byed pa las ring du zhugs par dbang thob pas na ring du song ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The stage of Gone Afar is so called because one has gone far from the mental orientation of the signs, and because one has attained the stage of Gone Afar, which is the cultivation of the non-manifestation of the formative forces that follow after.

original: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa dag dang lhun gyis grub pa dang lhun gyis ma grub pa kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang bas las kyi rlung la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang g-yo bar mi nus pas na mi g-yo ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa dag dang lhun gyis grub pa dang lhun gyis ma grub pa kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang bas las kyi rlung la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang g-yo bar mi nus pas na mi g-yo ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The stage of Immovability is so called because one has attained mastery over the non-manifestation of the signs, and because one is not moved by the winds of karma, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi chos ston pa la dbang bas kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros rgya chen po brnyes pa thob pas na legs pa'i blo gros zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi chos ston pa la dbang bas kha na ma tho ba med pa'i blo gros rgya chen po brnyes pa thob pas na legs pa'i blo gros zhes brjod do //
translated: The stage of Excellent Intelligence is so called because one has attained the vast, irreproachable intelligence which is the mastery over the teaching of the Dharma in all its aspects.

original: sprin rum mthug pe lta bu'i chos kyi mdzod kyis khams gsum kun du son pa nam mkha' lta bu'i sems can gyi khams rnams la chos kyi char gyis tshim par byed pas chos kyi sprin zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sprin rum mthug pe lta bu'i chos kyi mdzod kyis khams gsum kun du son pa nam mkha' lta bu'i sems can gyi khams rnams la chos kyi char gyis tshim par byed pas chos kyi sprin zhes brjod do //
translated: The eleventh stage is called Cloud of Dharma because it is like a thick cloud filled with the treasury of Dharma, and it satisfies the realm of sentient beings, which is like the sky, pervading the three realms, with the rain of Dharma.

original: shin tu phra mo'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa las chags pa med cing mi shigs pa'i shes bya rtogs pa thob pas na bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyis zhes brjod do //
analyzed: shin tu phra mo'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa las chags pa med cing mi shigs pa'i shes bya rtogs pa thob pas na bcu gcig pa sangs rgyas kyis zhes brjod do //
translated: The twelfth stage is called Vajra Holder because it is the attainment of the realization of the object of knowledge that is free from attachment and indestructible due to the abandonment of the obscuration of the afflictions that is extremely subtle.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ma lus pa spangs pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa thob pas na bcu gnyis pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ma lus pa spangs pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa thob pas na bcu gnyis pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa zhes brjod do //
translated: The twelfth stage is called the stage of the vajra holder because it is the attainment of the manifest enlightenment of the knowledge of all aspects due to the abandonment of all the latent propensities of the afflictions.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu rnams ni mos pa spyod pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu rnams ni mos pa spyod pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The ten stages such as the Joyous are the nature of the stage of devoted engagement.

original: mos pa spyod pa rnams kyang rgyur gyur pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa la bzhugs ba las so so ma yin pas so //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa rnams kyang rgyur gyur pas 'bras bur gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa la bzhugs ba las so so ma yin pas so //
translated: Since the stage of devoted engagement is also a cause, it is not different from the stage of buddhahood, which is the result.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa yang 'bras bur gyur pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa'i rgyur gyur pas dbyer med pa'i phyir mos pa spyod pa'i sa dang / sangs rgyas kyis sa dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa sa bcu dang dbyer med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sa yang 'bras bur gyur pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa'i rgyur gyur pas dbyer med pa'i phyir mos pa spyod pa'i sa dang / sangs rgyas kyis sa dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa sa bcu dang dbyer med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since the stage of buddhahood, which is the result, is also the cause of the stage of the vajra holder, which is the result, they are inseparable. Therefore, the stage of devoted engagement, the stage of buddhahood, and the stage of the vajra holder are inseparable from the ten stages.

original: sa bcu dang dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur @76b khrod ni dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: sa bcu dang dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur @76b khrod ni dbyer med pa ste /
translated: The ten stages and the charnel grounds and the nearby charnel grounds are inseparable.

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu'i rim pa ji lta bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa dang / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu'i rim pa ji lta bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The nearby abodes and so on and the ten stages such as the Joyous should be applied in the same way.

original: sa bcu dbang phyug mgon po nyid //
analyzed: sa bcu dbang phyug mgon po nyid //
translated: The ten stages are the lord of the heroes.

original: mgon po rdo rje 'dzin pa dang gnyi ga yang bstan to //
analyzed: mgon po rdo rje 'dzin pa dang gnyi ga yang bstan to //
translated: Both the lord and the vajra holder are taught.

original: gzhan gyis tha dad par sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa las tha dad pa nyid ni sa bcu gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis tha dad par sangs rgyas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa las tha dad pa nyid ni sa bcu gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: The other, the stage of the vajra-holder, is not different from the stage of the Buddha.

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po dang yul rnam par dag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po dang yul rnam par dag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The ten stages of the bodhisattva, such as the stage of 'Joy', should be regarded as the pure sense-organs and sense-objects.

original: dur khrod sangs rgyas kyi sa ni /
analyzed: dur khrod sangs rgyas kyi sa ni /
translated: The stage of the Buddha is the charnel-ground.

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par dag par blta'o //üîΩnye ba'i dur khrod ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par dag par blta'o // nye ba'i dur khrod ni /
translated: It should be regarded as the complete purity of consciousness.üîΩThe stage of the vajra-holder is the nearby charnel-ground.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa ste bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba las 'das par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sa ste bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba las 'das par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the transcendence of the experience of the aspects of bliss, etc.

original: 'dir rdo rje gsum dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dir rdo rje gsum dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Here, it is because of the non-difference from the three vajras.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa rnam kun nyid sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas dang rdo rje 'dzin pa rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa la khyad par ci yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa rnam kun nyid sa bcu'i dbang phyug gi byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas dang rdo rje 'dzin pa rnams rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mngon par byang chub pa la khyad par ci yang med pa yin no //
translated: The Bodhisattvas, Buddhas, and Vajradharas are all the same in every way, and the Bodhisattvas, Buddhas, and Vajradharas who are lords of the ten stages are not at all different in their manifest enlightenment to omniscience.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, Vajrasattva is Vajradhara.

original: sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: The great being is the Buddha.

original: dam tshig sems dpa' ni gang byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' ni gang byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The commitment being is the Bodhisattva.

original: rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye ba mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bstan zin to //
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye ba mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bstan zin to //
translated: The summary and detailed explanation of the division of the Vajra family is finished.

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa bcu ni dbang po dang yul rnams so //
analyzed: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa bcu ni dbang po dang yul rnams so //
translated: The ten places such as the abode and the neighboring abode are the faculties and the objects.

original: dur khrod ni n'a da'i bdag nyid kyi thugs so //
analyzed: dur khrod ni n'a da'i bdag nyid kyi thugs so //
translated: The charnel ground is the mind of the nature of nƒÅda.

original: nye ba'i dur khrod ni de las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i dur khrod ni de las 'das pa'o //
translated: The neighboring charnel ground is beyond that.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das gnas la sogs pa du lags zhes pa ni /
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das gnas la sogs pa du lags zhes pa ni /
translated: The question How many are the abodes, etc. ?

original: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa bcu gnyis bshad pa de dbye na du las zhes rdo rje snying pos zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang nye ba'i gnas la sogs pa bcu gnyis bshad pa de dbye na du las zhes rdo rje snying pos zhus pa'o //
translated: The Vajra Heart says, If they are divided, how many are there?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said:

original: gnas ni dz'a landha rar bshad //
analyzed: gnas ni dz'a landha rar bshad //
translated: The place is explained as Jalandhara.

original: de bzhin du ni au dyan nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni au dyan nyid //
translated: And likewise, Oddiyana itself.

original: gnas ni ko l'a gi ri nyid //
analyzed: gnas ni ko l'a gi ri nyid //
translated: The place is Kollagir itself.

original: de bzhin du yang k'a ma r'u //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang k'a ma r'u //
translated: And likewise, Kamaru.

original: 'di nyid gnas kyi dbye ba bzhi'o //üîΩnye gnas ma la wa zhes brjod //
analyzed: 'di nyid gnas kyi dbye ba bzhi'o // nye gnas ma la wa zhes brjod //
translated: These are the four divisions of the place.üîΩThe approach is called Malava.

original: sindhu na ga ra nyid do //
analyzed: sindhu na ga ra nyid do //
translated: And Sindhu Nagar itself.

original: de ltar nye ba'i gnas kyi dbye ba gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar nye ba'i gnas kyi dbye ba gsum mo //
translated: Thus, there are three divisions of the approach.

original: zhing ni mu m'u nir bshad do //
analyzed: zhing ni mu m'u nir bshad do //
translated: The field is explained as Mummu.

original: zhing ni byed pa'i grong khyer ro //
analyzed: zhing ni byed pa'i grong khyer ro //
translated: The field is the city of action.

original: de bzhin de w'i ko ti zhing //
analyzed: de bzhin de w'i ko ti zhing //
translated: And likewise, Devakota is the field.

original: zhing ni lcags pa'i brang nyid do //
analyzed: zhing ni lcags pa'i brang nyid do //
translated: The field is Kalinga itself.

original: 'di ni zhing gi dbye ba bzhi'o //üîΩnye @77a * //
analyzed: 'di ni zhing gi dbye ba bzhi'o // nye @77a * //
translated: These are the four divisions of the field.

original: zhing ku la ta zhes brjod //
analyzed: zhing ku la ta zhes brjod //
translated: The near field is called Kuluta.

original: de bzhin aar bu nyid dang ni /
analyzed: de bzhin aar bu nyid dang ni /
translated: And likewise, Arbuda itself,

original: ba yi mchod sbyin kha ba'i ri //
analyzed: ba yi mchod sbyin kha ba'i ri //
translated: and the mountain of Pushkara.

original: nye ba'i zhing ni mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i zhing ni mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: The adjacent field is the brief one.

original: 'di ni nye ba'i zhing bzhi'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nye ba'i zhing bzhi'i dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the division of the four adjacent fields.üîΩThe Cchandohas are the Harikelas,üîΩthe salt produced in the ocean,

original: tstshando ha ri ke la dang // lan tshva rgya mtsho'i nang skyes dang // zhes pa ni ha ri ke la khyad par du byed pa'o //
analyzed: tstshando ha ri ke la dang // lan tshva rgya mtsho'i nang skyes dang // zhes pa ni ha ri ke la khyad par du byed pa'o //
translated: and so on. The Harikelas are distinguished.

original: lam b'a ka dang k'a nytsi nyid /
analyzed: lam b'a ka dang k'a nytsi nyid /
translated: The Lamvakas and the Kancikas,

original: de bzhin soo r'a shta nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin soo r'a shta nyid //
translated: and likewise the Saurashtras,

original: 'di na tstshando ha'i dbye ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di na tstshando ha'i dbye ba bzhi'o //
translated: are the four divisions of the Cchandohas here.

original: nye ba'i tstshando ka lingga //üîΩgser dang ldan pa'i gling dang ni //
analyzed: nye ba'i tstshando ka lingga // gser dang ldan pa'i gling dang ni //
translated: The adjacent Cchandohas are the Kalings,üîΩthe Suvarnadvipas,

original: gser gling zhes gang grags pa de yin no //
analyzed: gser gling zhes gang grags pa de yin no //
translated: and the Suvarnadvipas, which are renowned.

original: nye ba'i tstshando kam ka na //
analyzed: nye ba'i tstshando kam ka na //
translated: The adjacent Cchandohas are the Kamkas,

original: de ltar nye ba'i tstshando ha'i dbye ba gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar nye ba'i tstshando ha'i dbye ba gsum mo //
translated: and thus there are three divisions of the adjacent Cchandohas.

original: 'thung gcod grong gi mthar gnas pa //
analyzed: 'thung gcod grong gi mthar gnas pa //
translated: The Kambojas are on the outskirts of the city,

original: grong gi bas mtha'i sa'o //
analyzed: grong gi bas mtha'i sa'o //
translated: and the outskirts of the city.

original: 'thung gcod grong khyer gyi dang / yang grong khyer gyi bas mtha'i sa'o //
analyzed: 'thung gcod grong khyer gyi dang / yang grong khyer gyi bas mtha'i sa'o //
translated: The Kambojas are on the outskirts of the city, and also on the outskirts of the city.

original: tsa ri tra dang ko sa la /
analyzed: tsa ri tra dang ko sa la /
translated: The Charitras and the Kosalas,

original: 'bigs byed gzhon nu'i grong khyer ro //
analyzed: 'bigs byed gzhon nu'i grong khyer ro //
translated: and the city of the youthful Vindhya.

original: nye ba'i 'thung gcod de dang nye ba ste tsa ri tra la sogs pa de dang nye bar gyur pa'i sa yang yin no //
analyzed: nye ba'i 'thung gcod de dang nye ba ste tsa ri tra la sogs pa de dang nye bar gyur pa'i sa yang yin no //
translated: That is the near-drinking place, and the land that is near that, such as TsƒÅritra, is also the near-drinking place.üîΩThus, the divisions of the drinking place and the near-drinking place are seven, and likewise, there are six, because the villages and cities are not distinguished. Therefore, there is one in the border region.

original: de ltar 'thung gcod dang nye ba'i 'thung gcod kyi rab tu dbye ba rnams gang yang bdun dang de bzhin du yang drug nyid de grong dang grong khyer dag dbyer med pas de na bas mtha'i sar gcig pa nyid de gang las she na /
analyzed: de ltar 'thung gcod dang nye ba'i 'thung gcod kyi rab tu dbye ba rnams gang yang bdun dang de bzhin du yang drug nyid de grong dang grong khyer dag dbyer med pas de na bas mtha'i sar gcig pa nyid de gang las she na /
translated: From where?

original: mdor bsdus pas ni brjod par bya //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pas ni brjod par bya //
translated: It is said in brief.

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: By the words:

original: kye rdo rje snying po snying rje che //
analyzed: kye rdo rje snying po snying rje che //
translated: O Hevajra, essence of great compassion,üîΩthe charnel ground, the assembly of pretas,

original: dur khrod ye dags 'dus pa dang // zhes pa ni dur khrod kyi sa'o //
analyzed: dur khrod ye dags 'dus pa dang // zhes pa ni dur khrod kyi sa'o //
translated: is the land of the charnel ground.

original: dur khrod rgya mtsho'i 'gram nyid dang // skyed tshal rab ni rdzing bu'i 'gram //üîΩzhes pa ni //
analyzed: dur khrod rgya mtsho'i 'gram nyid dang // skyed tshal rab ni rdzing bu'i 'gram // zhes pa ni //
translated: The charnel ground, the ocean shore, the garden, the pond shore,

original: dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi dbye ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod kyi dbye ba bzhi'o //
translated: are the four divisions of the charnel ground and the near charnel ground.

original: yang na dur khrod yi dags 'dus pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: yang na dur khrod yi dags 'dus pa zhes pa la /
translated: Or, in the charnel ground, the assembly of pretas,

original: yi dags ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yi dags ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The hungry ghost is the vajra holder.

original: de'i 'dus pa ni tshogs nas bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa yin par ma ning du bstan to //
analyzed: de'i 'dus pa ni tshogs nas bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa yin par ma ning du bstan to //
translated: His assembly is the gathering of the vajra holders who are inseparable from NairƒÅtmya, as indicated by the neuter gender.

original: rgya mtsho'i 'gram ni de nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi chu byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i 'gram ni de nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes kyi chu byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The ocean shore is the water of the gnosis of that very vajra holder, the bodhicitta.

original: de ster bas na rgya mtsho'o //üîΩmtsho ni phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: de ster bas na rgya mtsho'o // mtsho ni phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: Since it is given, it is the ocean.üîΩThe lake is the vajra holder endowed with the consort.

original: de'i 'gram ni pha mtha' 'di tshun chad nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i 'gram ni pha mtha' 'di tshun chad nyid rdo rje 'dzin pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: His shore is the limit of the other, the vajra holder.

original: de yang skyed mos tshal ni de las byung ba ste spro ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang skyed mos tshal ni de las byung ba ste spro ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That is also the garden, which is the nature of the emanation from it.

original: de nyid rdzing bu'i 'gram ste /
analyzed: de nyid rdzing bu'i 'gram ste /
translated: That very one is the shore of the lake.

original: pa ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: pa ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Pa is the bodhicitta.

original: aa ni bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: aa ni bdag med ma'o //
translated: A is NairƒÅtmya.

original: de rnyed nas thob par byed pas na /
analyzed: de rnyed nas thob par byed pas na /
translated: Having found that, it is made into the attainment.

original: rdzing bu ste rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer @77b med pa'i bdag med mas sdom pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: rdzing bu ste rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer @77b med pa'i bdag med mas sdom pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The lake is the nature of the restraint of NairƒÅtmya, who is inseparable from the vajra holder.

original: de'i 'gram ni /
analyzed: de'i 'gram ni /
translated: His shore is

original: pha rol 'di tshun chad nyid bdag med ma yin no //üîΩbrjod par bya ba ni /
analyzed: pha rol 'di tshun chad nyid bdag med ma yin no // brjod par bya ba ni /
translated: This is the other side, which is not NairƒÅtmya.üîΩThe object of expression is

original: gsal bar byed pa'o //üîΩde ltar dur khrod kyi sa bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'o // de ltar dur khrod kyi sa bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: the illuminator.üîΩThus, the cemetery is Vajradhara, who is not different from NairƒÅtmya.

original: nye ba'i dur khrod ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i dur khrod ni rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'o //
translated: The nearby cemetery is NairƒÅtmya, who is not different from Vajradhara.

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nying gnyis n'a da phred gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nying gnyis n'a da phred gnyis yin no //
translated: The two selves of both are the two nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s.

original: de ltar gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dag gi dbye ba rnam pa bdun dang / zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dag rnam pa brgyad dang / tstshando dang tstshando ha dag kyang rnam pa bdun dang / 'thung gcod dang nye ba'i 'thung gcod drug dang // dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod dag rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gnas dang nye ba'i gnas dag gi dbye ba rnam pa bdun dang / zhing dang nye ba'i zhing dag rnam pa brgyad dang / tstshando dang tstshando ha dag kyang rnam pa bdun dang / 'thung gcod dang nye ba'i 'thung gcod drug dang // dur khrod dang nye ba'i dur khrod dag rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: Thus, the sevenfold division of the abodes and the nearby abodes, the eightfold division of the fields and the nearby fields, the sevenfold division of the caityas and the nearby caityas, the sixfold division of the cremation grounds and the nearby cremation grounds, and the fourfold division of the charnel grounds and the nearby charnel grounds.

original: gnas la sogs pa rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par dag pas sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dbye bas tha dad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par dag pas sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dbye bas tha dad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The abodes and so on are differentiated by the thirty-two divisions because the thirty-two nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s are pure.

original: de nas rkyang ma dang rum dang / kun 'dar ma gsum 'og dang steng dang bar dz'a la ndha ra la sogs pa'i gnas gsum du son pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rkyang ma dang rum dang / kun 'dar ma gsum 'og dang steng dang bar dz'a la ndha ra la sogs pa'i gnas gsum du son pa'o //
translated: Then, the three channels lalanƒÅ, rasanƒÅ, and avadh≈´tƒ´ are located below, above, and in the middle, in the three places of the secret area, navel, and heart, respectively.

original: mi phyed ma la sogs pa gsum skor ma la thug pa'i rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi mgo nas gzung ba mdoms la thug pa'i gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnam par dag pa k'a ma r'u pa la sogs pa gzhon nu'i grong khyer la thug par ro //
analyzed: mi phyed ma la sogs pa gsum skor ma la thug pa'i rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi mgo nas gzung ba mdoms la thug pa'i gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnam par dag pa k'a ma r'u pa la sogs pa gzhon nu'i grong khyer la thug par ro //
translated: The three channels beginning with the indestructible, which are twenty-four channels ending with the channel-wheel, are located in the twenty-four places beginning with the head and ending with the genitals, which are the twenty-four pure abodes such as KƒÅmar≈´pa, ending with the city of youth.

original: 'dod ma dang / khyim ma dang / gtum mo dang / 'dod ma dang // khye'u dang / rtsa lnga ni snying ga'i padmar gnas pa bdud rtsi lnga 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod ma dang / khyim ma dang / gtum mo dang / 'dod ma dang // khye'u dang / rtsa lnga ni snying ga'i padmar gnas pa bdud rtsi lnga 'bab pa'o //
translated: The five channels of the desire, home, fierce, desiring, and boy are located in the heart lotus, from which the five nectars flow.

original: de dang nye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzing bu'i 'gram gyi mthar gnas lnga rnams so //
analyzed: de dang nye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzing bu'i 'gram gyi mthar gnas lnga rnams so //
translated: The five places called ‚Äúnear that‚Äù and so on are located on the edge of the pond.

original: de ltar sa bcu gnyis tha dad du phye bas sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ltar sa bcu gnyis tha dad du phye bas sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, the twelve stages are differentiated as thirty-two.

original: gnas sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams su thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin gyis rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: gnas sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams su thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin gyis rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: The Vajra dakinis are the nature of the thirty-two channel cakras, which are the nature of the thirty-two places, with the nature of means and insight.

original: srid gsum yongs su gyur nas /
analyzed: srid gsum yongs su gyur nas /
translated: Having transformed the three worlds,

original: spro ba dang bsdu ba la 'jug pas rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye bas mdor bstan nas rtsa'i 'khor lo'i rang bzhin rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i 'du bas rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: spro ba dang bsdu ba la 'jug pas rdo rje rigs kyi rim par phye bas mdor bstan nas rtsa'i 'khor lo'i rang bzhin rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i 'du bas rgyas par bstan to //
translated: the Vajra family is taught in brief by the process of emanation and re-absorption, and the Vajra Yoginis are taught in detail by the assembly of the nature of the channel cakras.

original: 'dis ni phyi rol dang nang dag don dam par tha dad pa rnam kun du med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyi rol dang nang dag don dam par tha dad pa rnam kun du med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that externally and internally, ultimately, there is no difference at all.

original: gnas 'di rnams su rnal 'byor ma 'du ba de srid du 'du ba'i gnas su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas 'di rnams su rnal 'byor ma 'du ba de srid du 'du ba'i gnas su bstan pa yin no //
translated: These places are taught as the places of assembly, since the Yoginis assemble there.

original: de nas lha thams cad dang rnal 'byor ma rnams 'du ste 'on kyang nyi ma gang la de rnams legs par 'du ba @78a * //
analyzed: de nas lha thams cad dang rnal 'byor ma rnams 'du ste 'on kyang nyi ma gang la de rnams legs par 'du ba @78a * //
translated: Then all the gods and Yoginis assemble. But on which day do they assemble well?

original: yin pa'i nyi ma bstan pa /
analyzed: yin pa'i nyi ma bstan pa /
translated: The day on which they assemble well is taught:

original: rnal 'byor ma yi legs 'du ba'i //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma yi legs 'du ba'i //
translated: The good assembly of the YoginisüîΩis on the eighth,üîΩthe fourteenth, and the fifteenth day of the lunar month.

original: nyin par nyid kyang rab bshad bya //
analyzed: nyin par nyid kyang rab bshad bya //
translated: And also during the day.

original: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings,

original: rnal 'byor ma rgyud dgyes rdo rje //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rgyud dgyes rdo rje //
translated: The Yoginƒ´ Tantra, Hevajra.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das zhes rdo rje snying po sdud pa po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das zhes rdo rje snying po sdud pa po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: O BhagavƒÅn, since Vajragarbha is the compiler,

original: rdo rje snying pos bcom ldan 'das nyid la mngon par btud nas /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos bcom ldan 'das nyid la mngon par btud nas /
translated: Vajragarbha, having bowed to the BhagavƒÅn himself,

original: nyi ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhus pa /
analyzed: nyi ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhus pa /
translated: asked in order to teach the sun:

original: kye bcom ldan 'das nyi ma yang kho bo la bka' stsal du gsol /
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das nyi ma yang kho bo la bka' stsal du gsol /
translated: O BhagavƒÅn, please teach me the sun as well.

original: cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
analyzed: cis khyad par du 'phags she na /
translated: How is it superior?

original: rnal 'byor ma'i legs 'du ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i legs 'du ba'o //
translated: The excellent gathering of Yoginƒ´s.

original: gang ngu zhe na /
analyzed: gang ngu zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rjer ro //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i rdo rjer ro //
translated: In the Hevajra Tantra.

original: cis khyad par 'phags she na //
analyzed: cis khyad par 'phags she na //
translated: How is it superior?

original: rnal 'byor ma rgyud do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rgyud do //
translated: The Yoginƒ´ Tantra.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings.

original: 'gro ba'i don zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught for the sake of migrating beings.

original: nyi ma gang lags /
analyzed: nyi ma gang lags /
translated: What is the sun?üîΩ The fifteenth and eighth of the dark fortnight,

original: yi dags zla phyed bcu bzhi dang // de bzhin du yang brgyad pa nyid //
analyzed: yi dags zla phyed bcu bzhi dang // de bzhin du yang brgyad pa nyid //
translated: and likewise the fourteenth as well,

original: rgyal mtshan dang ni mtshon bsnun nyid //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang ni mtshon bsnun nyid //
translated: The banner and the one struck by the weapon,

original: lan bdun pa yang bza' bar bya //
analyzed: lan bdun pa yang bza' bar bya //
translated: the one who is born seven times, and also the one who is eaten.

original: nyi ma nyi ma du yin /
analyzed: nyi ma nyi ma du yin /
translated: What is the day of the sun?

original: gang la rgyal mtshan te dpyangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la rgyal mtshan te dpyangs pa'o //
translated: The one on which the banner is hoisted.

original: mtshon bsnun te g-yul ngor bsad pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon bsnun te g-yul ngor bsad pa'o //
translated: The one struck by the weapon is the one killed in battle.

original: cir 'gyur zhe na lan bdun pa'o //
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhe na lan bdun pa'o //
translated: What happens? The one who is born seven times.

original: skye ba bdun pa gang gi grib ma'ang bdun du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba bdun pa gang gi grib ma'ang bdun du gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who is born seven times is the one whose shadow is sevenfold.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bu nyi ma gang la bza' ba de'i nyi ma ni yi dgas zla phyed bcu bzhi dang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyes bu nyi ma gang la bza' ba de'i nyi ma ni yi dgas zla phyed bcu bzhi dang ngo //
translated: The day on which such a person eats is the day of the sun, the day of the hungry ghost, the fourteenth or the eighth.

original: de la ni zla phyed de la'am tshes brgyad de la'o //
analyzed: de la ni zla phyed de la'am tshes brgyad de la'o //
translated: The half-month is that day, or the eighth.

original: yang na / nyin par nyid kyang rab bshad bya //
analyzed: yang na / nyin par nyid kyang rab bshad bya //
translated: The day of the sun is also explained.

original: zhes pa ni nyi ma ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyi ma ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The sun is the vajra-holder.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ni shin tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ni shin tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: That itself is to be explained, that which makes it very clear.

original: rnal 'byor ma yi legs 'du pa //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma yi legs 'du pa // zhes pa ni /
translated: The gathering of the yoginis

original: rnal 'byor pa bco lnga ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa bco lnga ste /
translated: is the gathering of the fifteen yoginis.

original: bdag med ma la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma de rnams dang bde bar sems khral med par bdag nyid gang de ru'o //
analyzed: bdag med ma la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma de rnams dang bde bar sems khral med par bdag nyid gang de ru'o //
translated: He, the Self, is in that place, i.e., in the abode of the dakinis, Nairatmya, etc., with a happy, carefree mind.

original: 'di'i phyir na rdo rje 'dzin pa dang mkha' 'gro ma tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir na rdo rje 'dzin pa dang mkha' 'gro ma tha dad pa med do //
translated: For this reason, the Vajra-holder and the dakinis are non-dual.

original: gang du de las zhe na dgyes pa'i rdo rje ste gnyis med du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang du de las zhe na dgyes pa'i rdo rje ste gnyis med du rtogs pa'o //
translated: Where is that? In the Hevajra, i.e., in the realization of non-duality.

original: de nyid ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid ji ltar yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: He himself declares just what that is:

original: rnal 'byor ma rgyud du'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rgyud du'o //
translated: In the Yoginitantra.

original: 'di la rnal 'byor yod pas na rnal 'byor ma ste /
analyzed: 'di la rnal 'byor yod pas na rnal 'byor ma ste /
translated: The Yoginis are those who have yoga, i.e., the dakinis.

original: de rnams bye brag tu bshad pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid kyis bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams bye brag tu bshad pa'i dgyes pa'i rdo rje gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid kyis bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are explained in the Hevajra Tantra, because they are explained as non-dual by their differentiation.

original: ci'i don du yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i don du yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: For what purpose? He says:

original: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir //
translated: For the sake of all beings.

original: kun ni rdo rje 'dzin pa ste kun la khyab pa'i phyir gnyis su @78b med pa'o //
analyzed: kun ni rdo rje 'dzin pa ste kun la khyab pa'i phyir gnyis su @78b med pa'o //
translated: All is the Vajra-holder, because he pervades all, and is non-dual.

original: sems can ni me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: sems can ni me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga dang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Beings are the five intuitions such as the mirror intuition, etc., and the three bodies.

original: sems can yang yin pa thams cad kyang yin pas sems can kun te don de nyid do //
analyzed: sems can yang yin pa thams cad kyang yin pas sems can kun te don de nyid do //
translated: All sentient beings are also sentient beings, thus all sentient beings.

original: don dam pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //

analyzed: bsad nas kyang ni bza' bar bya //

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

analyzed: 'bad pas snying rje bskyed pa yis so //

original: 'bad pa zhes pa ni mi bskyed pa la sogs pa'i lha'i rang bzhin gyis mi bskyed pa la sogs pa'i rigs su de'i shes pa khyer nas mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin du rdzogs pas na //

analyzed: sems can de'i kha na mtho ba'i skyon med pa yin te 'bad pas so //

analyzed: snying rje'i thabs dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa la gsod pa zhes pa'i skyon med pa'i don to //

analyzed: / de lta na yang snying rje'i dbang gis gsad par bya ba yin no //

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

translated: Are those who gather there, the yogis and yoginƒ´s, necessarily devoted to the siddhi of mahƒÅmudrƒÅ?

original: ci yin du chug kyang sems can mos pa sna @79b tshogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci yin du chug kyang sems can mos pa sna @79b tshogs pa'i phyir /

analyzed: mkha' spyod la sogs pa'i dngos grub la mos pa'i sems can kyang der 'du'o //

analyzed: de bas na de'i don du yang skye ba bdun ba bsgrub pa'i zas kyang nye bar dgos pa yin no //

analyzed: de yang snying rje'i bdag nyid kyis bsod nams kyang bza' bar rigs pa yin no //

analyzed: yang na 'di ni lta ba gzhan la rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi gzhag pa'i tshig yin te //
translated: Or, this is a statement of the position of those who stand in another view.

original: gang las zhe na /
analyzed: gang las zhe na /
translated: From where?

original: 'bad pas snying rje bskyed pa yis //
analyzed: 'bad pas snying rje bskyed pa yis //
translated: By generating compassion with effort,

original: mkhas pas gsad par bya ba yin //
analyzed: mkhas pas gsad par bya ba yin //
translated: the wise one should kill.

analyzed: bdag nyid sdug bsngal las bsgral bar 'dod pa dang / bdag nyid bde ba 'dod pas 'jug pa'o //

original: 'bad pas ni rnam pa sna tshogs la brten nas so //
analyzed: 'bad pas ni rnam pa sna tshogs la brten nas so //

original: gang gis gsod par byed pa de ci mkhas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis gsod par byed pa de ci mkhas pa ma yin te /

original: mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal mi shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal mi shes pa nyid yin te /

original: rang gi bde ba tsam la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bde ba tsam la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //

original: khyod cag de rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: khyod cag de rnams kyi'o //
translated: That is yours.

original: snying rje med na mi 'grub pas //
analyzed: snying rje med na mi 'grub pas //
translated: If there is no compassion, it is not accomplished.

original: de phyir snying rje bskyed par bya //
analyzed: de phyir snying rje bskyed par bya //

original: snying rje med na zhes pa ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las bsgral bar 'dod pa de rnams la med pas na snying rje med pa zhes brjod do //

translated: Without compassion means that one who desires to liberate sentient beings from suffering and the causes of suffering is said to be without compassion because of the absence of those.

original: de mi 'grub pa ni de rnams phyag rgya'i dngos grub mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de mi 'grub pa ni de rnams phyag rgya'i dngos grub mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: Not accomplishing means not accomplishing the spiritual power of the seal of those.

original: de bas na snying rje brtse ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na snying rje brtse ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should generate compassionate affection.

original: nye ba'i sgras nye ba'i don yin pa'i phyir sems can la dmigs pa'i snying rje gzung bar bya ba'i chos la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye ba'i sgras nye ba'i don yin pa'i phyir sems can la dmigs pa'i snying rje gzung bar bya ba'i chos la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The word near means that the compassion focused on sentient beings is to be taken, not the compassion focused on the apprehended phenomena.

original: yang na snying rje zhes pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin de bcom ldan 'das dgyes pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yang na snying rje zhes pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin de bcom ldan 'das dgyes pa'i rdo rje'o //

original: de med pa ni snying rje med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni snying rje med pa'o //
translated: Without that is without compassion.

original: mi 'grub pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'grub pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub 'grub par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Not accomplishing means not accomplishing the spiritual power of the great seal.

original: de'i phyir snying rje bskyed par bya ba ni rgyu de nyid kyis na rdo rje 'dzin pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje bskyed par bya ba ni rgyu de nyid kyis na rdo rje 'dzin pa bskyed par bya'o //

original: gdug pa thams cad gzhug bya ste //
analyzed: gdug pa thams cad gzhug bya ste //

analyzed: cho ga'i gtso bos rab tu bsgrub //

analyzed: de rnams nyid gzhug par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: gtso bo ni gtso bor ro //

analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid kyis 'grub po //

original: rab tu bsgrub pa gsad pa la sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu bsgrub pa gsad pa la sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The accomplishment is the killing, etc.

original: de la 'di ltar blta bar bya //
analyzed: de la 'di ltar blta bar bya //
translated: That should be seen in this way:

original: nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can //
analyzed: nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can //
translated: The Blessed One is the Vajra-HolderüîΩin the daytime.

original: mtshan mo shes @80a * //
analyzed: mtshan mo shes @80a * //
translated: The wisdom

original: rab brtag par bya //
analyzed: rab brtag par bya //
translated: should be examined at night.

original: de bas na thabs la mkhas pa rnams kyis 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba yang gang /
analyzed: de bas na thabs la mkhas pa rnams kyis 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba yang gang /
translated: Therefore, even that which is contrary to the world should be done by those skilled in means.

original: de 'jig rten las 'das pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'jig rten las 'das pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: That is the transcendent.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang gang de 'jig rten pa nyid du 'khor bar 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang gang de 'jig rten pa nyid du 'khor bar 'jug pa yin no //
translated: And the transcendent, when it enters into the cycle of existence as the mundane,
