analyzed: nyin mo rab tu gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan no //
translated: is the quality of the day, which has the characteristic of illumination.

original: de rdo rje can ni /
analyzed: de rdo rje can ni /
translated: That is the vajra-holder.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: The Blessed One is the vajra-holder.

original: mtshan mo ni nub mo ste mun pa'i rang bzhin can gyi skyon no //
analyzed: mtshan mo ni nub mo ste mun pa'i rang bzhin can gyi skyon no //
translated: The night is the evening, which has the characteristic of darkness, the fault.

original: de ni shes rab po //
analyzed: de ni shes rab po //
translated: That is wisdom.

original: skyon dang / yon tan rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / bdag med ma'i rang bzhin dag yin te /
analyzed: skyon dang / yon tan rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / bdag med ma'i rang bzhin dag yin te /
translated: The fault and the quality are the nature of the vajra-holder and of Nairatmya,

original: de'i phyir yon tan nyid skyon la skyon nyid yon tan te gnyi ga dbyer med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan nyid skyon la skyon nyid yon tan te gnyi ga dbyer med pa yin no //
translated: respectively. Therefore, the quality itself is the fault, and the fault itself is the quality, and the two are inseparable.

original: 'dis ci bstan na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: thabs la mi mkhas pa'i mu stegs pa rnams kyi yon tan dge ba nyid skyon du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mi mkhas pa'i mu stegs pa rnams kyi yon tan dge ba nyid skyon du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The quality, the virtue, of the tirthikas who are unskilled in means becomes a fault.

original: thabs la mkhas pa rnams kyi yang skyon nyid yon tan du 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa rnams kyi yang skyon nyid yon tan du 'gyur pa'o //
translated: And the fault itself of those who are skilled in means becomes a quality.

original: 'bad pas snying rje bskyed pa yis //
analyzed: 'bad pas snying rje bskyed pa yis //
translated: By the effort of generating compassion,

original: mkhas pas gsad par bya ba yin //
analyzed: mkhas pas gsad par bya ba yin //
translated: The wise one should kill it.

original: zhes gang bstan pa de thams cad shin tu dag pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bstan pa de thams cad shin tu dag pa yin no //
translated: All that has been taught is very pure.

original: yang na de la zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de la zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Or else, ‚Äúin it‚Äù means ‚Äúin that way it is established.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar blta ba'i 'di ltar zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar blta ba'i 'di ltar zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way one should see‚Äù is the gnosis of the inseparability of method and wisdom.

original: shes par bya ba ni ye shes kyi rnam pas 'di rnam par gzhag go ;
analyzed: shes par bya ba ni ye shes kyi rnam pas 'di rnam par gzhag go ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of knowledge‚Äù is established by the aspect of gnosis.

original: snying rje bskyed pa las gzhan gyis don la dbang bas gang gsad pa de gnyi ga yang dbyer med pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje bskyed pa las gzhan gyis don la dbang bas gang gsad pa de gnyi ga yang dbyer med pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see that both the one who kills and the one who is killed are inseparable, since the meaning of the other is controlled by the generation of compassion.

original: nyi ma gang lags zhes gang gsungs pa de rgyas par 'chad pa nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can ni spo ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: nyi ma gang lags zhes gang gsungs pa de rgyas par 'chad pa nyin mo bcom ldan rdo rje can ni spo ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: As for what was said, ‚ÄúWhat is the day?‚Äù the explanation of that in detail is ‚ÄúThe day is the Blessed One, the vajra holder, the nature of movement.‚Äù

original: mtshan mo ni nub mo ste de ni shes rab po //
analyzed: mtshan mo ni nub mo ste de ni shes rab po //
translated: ‚ÄúNight‚Äù is evening, and that is wisdom.

original: bsdu ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of gathering.

original: gnyi ga'i rtog pa yang rab tu gsal bar bstan pas spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa'i kun du rtog pa yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rtog pa yang rab tu gsal bar bstan pas spro ba dang bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa dang bdag med ma dbyer med pa'i kun du rtog pa yang med pa yin no //
translated: Since both concepts are clearly taught, there is also no concept of the indivisibility of Vajradhara and NairƒÅtmya, who are the nature of emanation and gathering.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: mi bya cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: mi bya cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: there is nothing at all that is not to be done.

original: bya ba ni bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba ni bya ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: What is to be done is what is to be done.

original: bya ba med pas bya ba ma yin pa yang med do //
analyzed: bya ba med pas bya ba ma yin pa yang med do //
translated: Since there is nothing to be done, there is also nothing not to be done.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa ni rtog pa kun las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa ni rtog pa kun las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vajradhara is beyond all concepts.

original: yang na de la 'du bar rnal 'byor mas gnag smras de dag thams cad bya zhes gnag mdor bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang na de la 'du bar rnal 'byor mas gnag smras de dag thams cad bya zhes gnag mdor bstan pa de'i rgyas par bshad pa 'di yin te /
translated: Or else, in response to Yoginƒ´‚Äôs question, ‚ÄúShould all of those be done?‚Äù this is the extensive explanation of that brief teaching:

original: cung zad yod ma yin zhes pa 'dis so //
analyzed: cung zad yod ma yin zhes pa 'dis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is nothing at all that is not to be done.‚Äù

original: de bas na 'jig rten pa dang @80b 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gal ba dang mi 'gal ba de la shes pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten pa dang @80b 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gal ba dang mi 'gal ba de la shes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no knowledge of contradiction or noncontradiction between the mundane and the supramundane.

original: yid kyi dbang du gyur pa de rnams sam de rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang du gyur pa de rnams sam de rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those are the objects of the mind, or they are the objects of the mind.

original: rtag tu mi bza' yod ma yin //
analyzed: rtag tu mi bza' yod ma yin //
translated: It is not always not to be eaten.

original: zhes pa ni der 'dus pa rnams kyi bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa yang bza' bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni der 'dus pa rnams kyi bza' bar bya ba ma yin pa yang bza' bar bya ba yin te /
translated: This means that even what is not to be eaten by those assembled there is to be eaten.

original: skye ba bdun pa'i sems can bza' ba yin pa na skye ba bdun pa yang spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba bdun pa'i sems can bza' ba yin pa na skye ba bdun pa yang spyad par bya'o //
translated: If the food is a being who has seven births, then one should enjoy the seven births.

original: yang gi sgras sems can gzhan yang bza' bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgras sems can gzhan yang bza' bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that other beings are also to be eaten.

original: gang sras de kun bza' bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang sras de kun bza' bar bya ste /
translated: One should eat that son.

original: kun du snang ba'i rang bzhin des sku'i sku rdo rje bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun du snang ba'i rang bzhin des sku'i sku rdo rje bza' bar bya'o //
translated: With that nature of universal illumination, one should eat the vajra body of the body.

original: de gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir mi bza' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de gdod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir mi bza' ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is originally unborn, it is not not to be eaten.

original: de ltar lus kyi kun tu rtog pa med pas de med pa'i rtog pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lus kyi kun tu rtog pa med pas de med pa'i rtog pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, since there is no conceptualization of the body, the conceptualization of its absence also does not exist.

original: mi bza' min zhes ba ma ning gi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi bza' min zhes ba ma ning gi bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot not to be eaten‚Äù is the teaching of the neuter.

original: de bas na rtag tu ni de yod par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtag tu ni de yod par gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it always exists.

original: aa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: aa rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: A is the dakini of the vajra.

original: bdag med ma'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: bdag med ma'i rang bzhin te /
translated: It is the nature of Nairatma.

original: lus kyi mngon par zhen pa'i mngon zhen med pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi mngon par zhen pa'i mngon zhen med pa yin no //
translated: There is no clinging to the body.

original: 'di la mi bsam yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di la mi bsam yod ma yin //
translated: There is no thought here.

original: gang smras pa de thams cad bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gang smras pa de thams cad bya ba yin te /
translated: Whatever is said, all that is to be done.

original: de'i phyir 'dir bsam pa'am mi bsam pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir bsam pa'am mi bsam pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no thought or non-thought here.

original: yang na bsam du med pa ma yin pa ni bsam par bya ba yin pas bsam pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bsam du med pa ma yin pa ni bsam par bya ba yin pas bsam pa'o //
translated: Or, that which is not unthinkable is to be thought, thus it is thought.

original: sems kyi yul lo //
analyzed: sems kyi yul lo //
translated: It is the object of the mind.

original: sems de nyid ni sems med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de'i yul yang med pas bsam par bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems de nyid ni sems med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de'i yul yang med pas bsam par bya ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That very mind is the object of that, because it is the nature of non-mind. Therefore, there is no object of thought.

original: de med pas mi bsam par bya ba yang med do //
analyzed: de med pas mi bsam par bya ba yang med do //
translated: Since that does not exist, there is also no non-thought.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because both are inseparable,

original: ye shes nyid yod pas de nyid rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes nyid yod pas de nyid rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: wisdom itself exists, and that is to be established.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di ltar 'dir ni dgyes pa'i rdo rjer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir ni dgyes pa'i rdo rjer ro //
translated: In this way, here in Hevajra.

original: bzang ngan mi smra gang yang med //
analyzed: bzang ngan mi smra gang yang med //
translated: There is no good or bad speech.

original: brjod par bya ba ni brjod pa tshig gi spyod yul du byas pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni brjod pa tshig gi spyod yul du byas pa'o //
translated: The expressible is made the domain of expression, words.

original: de ni yang sems kyi yul yin pa'i phyir sems de yang sems ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yang sems kyi yul yin pa'i phyir sems de yang sems ma yin no //
translated: Since that is also the object of mind, that mind is also not mind.

original: tshig nyid kyang med de /
analyzed: tshig nyid kyang med de /
translated: Even the word does not exist.

original: de'i dngos po med pa las tshig kyang med do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po med pa las tshig kyang med do //
translated: Since there is no entity of that, the word also does not exist.

original: de bas na brjod pa dang brjod pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa med pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa'i kun du rtog pa zad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na brjod pa dang brjod pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa med pa'i phyir dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / mtshan ma dang / mtshan ma med pa'i kun du rtog pa zad pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the absence of the conceptualization of expression and non-expression, the conceptualization of virtue and non-virtue and of signs and signlessness is exhausted.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i kun rtog la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i kun rtog la //
translated: The conceptualization of the bodhisattva

original: gang tshe dag pa'am mi dge ba //
analyzed: gang tshe dag pa'am mi dge ba //
translated: When it is pure or impure

original: thams cad dge ba nyid 'gyur te //
analyzed: thams cad dge ba nyid 'gyur te //
translated: All becomes virtue itself,

original: gang phyir de rnams yid dbang @81a * //
analyzed: gang phyir de rnams yid dbang @81a * //
translated: Because those are the mind‚Äôs domain.

original: yin ; / de lta bas na gang smras pa de kun bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yin ; / de lta bas na gang smras pa de kun bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, everything that is said is to be done,

original: de thams cad rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i kun du rtog pa las 'das pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i kun du rtog pa las 'das pa nyid yin no //
translated: because all of that is beyond the conceptualization of the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: bza' ba dang mi bza' ba'i kun tu rtog pa yongs su spangs pas lus kyi kun du rtog pa yongs su zad nas /
analyzed: bza' ba dang mi bza' ba'i kun tu rtog pa yongs su spangs pas lus kyi kun du rtog pa yongs su zad nas /
translated: He is the Blessed One because he has eliminated the conceptual thoughts of body by completely abandoning the conceptual thoughts of what to eat and what not to eat.

original: lus kyi rtog pa yongs su spangs pa'i bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: lus kyi rtog pa yongs su spangs pa'i bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He is the Blessed One because he has eliminated the conceptual thoughts of body.

original: bsam pa dang mi bsam pa'i rtog pa las 'das pa'i phyir /üîΩsems kyi kun du rtog pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dang mi bsam pa'i rtog pa las 'das pa'i phyir / sems kyi kun du rtog pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: He is beyond the conceptual thoughts of mind because he has transcended the conceptual thoughts of what to think and what not to think.

original: brjod pa dang mi smra ba'i rtog pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /üîΩngag gi kun du rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang mi smra ba'i rtog pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir / ngag gi kun du rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: He is free from the conceptual thoughts of speech because he has completely abandoned the conceptual thoughts of what to say and what not to say.

original: de bas na kun du rtog pa gsum yongs su spangs pa'i phyir de ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de bas na kun du rtog pa gsum yongs su spangs pa'i phyir de ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Therefore, he is the Blessed One because he has completely abandoned the three conceptual thoughts.üîΩThe conceptual thought of self and other is also said to be untrue:üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.

original: bdag dang gzhan du shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang mi bden pa nyid yin par gsungs pa /üîΩji ltar bdag nyid de bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang mi bden pa nyid yin par gsungs pa / ji ltar bdag nyid de bzhin gzhan //
translated: Just as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.

original: ji ltar bdag nyid nga dang gzhan //üîΩji ltar bdag nga zhes pa ni rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid nga dang gzhan //üîΩji ltar bdag nga zhes pa ni rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: Just as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.üîΩJust as it is for oneself, so it is for others.

original: de bzhin gzhan ni 'gro ba ris drug kyang rab tu shes par bya'o //üîΩji ltar sems can gzhan zhes pa ni gzhan du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan ni 'gro ba ris drug kyang rab tu shes par bya'o // ji ltar sems can gzhan zhes pa ni gzhan du shes pa'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand the other, the six types of beings.

original: de bzhin du bdag kyang gzhan du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag kyang gzhan du shes par bya'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚Äúother sentient beings,‚Äù so one should understand the other, oneself.

original: de ltar rang dang gzhan gnyi ga gzhan du brjes nas gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid rang dang gzhan gyi rtog pa med pa yin no //üîΩyang na ji ltar bdag ni yod do //
analyzed: de ltar rang dang gzhan gnyi ga gzhan du brjes nas gnyi ga dbyer med pa nyid rang dang gzhan gyi rtog pa med pa yin no // yang na ji ltar bdag ni yod do //
translated: Thus, having exchanged both oneself and others, there is no conception of self and other, since both are nondual.

original: bzhes pa ni /
analyzed: bzhes pa ni /
translated: Or else, as it is said, ‚ÄúI exist.‚Äù

original: bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: The ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the pride of Vajradhara inseparable from NairƒÅtmya.

original: ji ltar sems can gzhan ni mchog ste de nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes yin gyi gzhan ma yin pas ngar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can gzhan ni mchog ste de nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes yin gyi gzhan ma yin pas ngar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther sentient beings‚Äù are supreme, since they are the true gnosis, not anything else.

original: de bzhin gzhan ni rnam par shes pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan ni rnam par shes pa yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, the other is also consciousness.

original: de ltar yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnam par rig par rtogs pas na nga ste /
analyzed: de ltar yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnam par rig par rtogs pas na nga ste /
translated: Thus, the ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the realization of the object, sense faculty, and consciousness.

original: yi ge aa dang ham gi rang bzhin gyi bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes de nyid mchog yang dag pa'i don to //
analyzed: yi ge aa dang ham gi rang bzhin gyi bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes de nyid mchog yang dag pa'i don to //
translated: The reality of the supreme truth is that very intuition of Vajradhara, inseparable from NairƒÅtmya, whose nature is the letters a and ha.

original: 'di ltar sems pa'i rnal 'byor bdag / bza' dang btung ba las sogs brtsam //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems pa'i rnal 'byor bdag / bza' dang btung ba las sogs brtsam //
translated: Thus, the yogi/nƒ´, the self, should begin with eating, drinking, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba'i rgyu 'dis ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rgyu 'dis ni /
translated: By this cause,

original: nga nyid gzhan la gzhan nyid nga'o zhes bsam mo //
analyzed: nga nyid gzhan la gzhan nyid nga'o zhes bsam mo //
translated: one should think, ‚ÄúI am the other, and the other is I.‚Äù

original: de bas na rnal 'byor bdag ni yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnal 'byor bdag ni yang dag pa'i rnal 'byor shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the yogi/nƒ´, the self, is the knower of the truth of yoga.

original: bza' dang btung ba la sogs ni /
analyzed: bza' dang btung ba la sogs ni /
translated: Eating, drinking, and so on,

original: bza' ba dang btung ba dang ston mo la sogs pa spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba dang ston mo la sogs pa spyad par bya'o //
translated: one should enjoy eating, drinking, feasting, and so on.

original: yang na bza' ba dang btung ba la @81b sogs ni bza' ba ni bza' ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bza' ba dang btung ba la @81b sogs ni bza' ba ni bza' ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, eating, drinking, and so on, eating is food,

original: de'i btung ba ni bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i btung ba ni bsrung ba'o //
translated: drinking is drink,

original: de nyid thog ma dang po'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de nyid thog ma dang po'i rgyu'o //
translated: that itself is the cause of the first beginning.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Such is the intuition.

original: spyad pa ni dmigs pa gsad pas kyang bya'o //
analyzed: spyad pa ni dmigs pa gsad pas kyang bya'o //
translated: One should also practice by killing the object.

original: 'bad pas snying rje bskyed pa yis /
analyzed: 'bad pas snying rje bskyed pa yis /
translated: By generating compassion with effort,

original: bsad nas kyang skye ba bdun pa bza' bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsad nas kyang skye ba bdun pa bza' bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: Having killed, it is proper to eat the seven-times-born.

original: gzhan gyi don du spyod pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa des bya ba yin no zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du spyod pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa des bya ba yin no zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is that this is the activity of the yogi who practices for the sake of others.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
translated: It will also be explained:

original: de yi grib ma'ang bdun du 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi grib ma'ang bdun du 'gyur //
translated: His shadow will be sevenfold.

original: de yi zos pa tsam gyis kyang //
analyzed: de yi zos pa tsam gyis kyang //
translated: By merely eating him,

original: dngos grub myur du thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos grub myur du thob par 'gyur //
translated: one will quickly attain power.

original: zhes pa'o // yang na rnal 'byor bdag ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: a'a nam ni sems so //

original: aa bdag med ma'o //

analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'o //

analyzed: yang na / 'gyur ni @83a * //

original: de gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gang dang gang gi mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi 'brel pa can gang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul de dang de mkhas pa de kho na nyid dang ldan pas so //

original: bza' bar bya ni 'khril bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ni 'khril bar bya ba ste /

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi bdag nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //

original: sems can de de ni /
analyzed: sems can de de ni /

analyzed: srid pa gsum gcig par gyur pa dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa dbyer med du yod pa'o //

analyzed: dbang ni bdag por 'gyur zhing thob pa ste /

original: 'di ji ltar yin zhe na /

analyzed: ka ni k'a li'o //

original: der sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: der sbyor ba ni /

analyzed: 'du ba yin pa ste /

translated: Thus, the sixth Vajradhara, whose nature is the five [realizations] of the five knowledges, which are the nature of conduct and action, is beyond. The seventh Vajradhara, whose nature is the perfect knowledge that is beyond, has the nature of the perfect knowledge of the five [realizations].

original: dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i rnam par bshad pa rab tu gsal ba'i kha sbyor gyi rgya cher 'grel pa las brda'i rim par phye ba ste le'u bdun pa'o /

original: de'i phyir 'di thams cad nyid kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di thams cad nyid kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all of this is the inseparability of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba yang /
translated: It will also be explained:

original: chos 'byung las skyes 'khor lo ni ;
analyzed: chos 'byung las skyes 'khor lo ni ;
translated: The wheel arises from the source of phenomena,

original: /'phar ma gnyis dag ces pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: /'phar ma gnyis dag ces pas kyang ngo //

original: de'i phyir 'dir thams cad nyid du phyi rol dang nang dag gi rim par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir thams cad nyid du phyi rol dang nang dag gi rim par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here everything should be applied in the sequence of the external and internal.

original: de nas 'khor lo bshad par bya ste //
analyzed: de nas 'khor lo bshad par bya ste //

original: nam mkha'i khams su bha ga bsam //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams su bha ga bsam //

original: dbus su bsgom par bya ba ni //
analyzed: dbus su bsgom par bya ba ni //

original: zhes pa la nam mkha'i khams ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa la nam mkha'i khams ni stong pa nyid do //

original: bha ga zhes pa ni chos 'byung zur gsum gyen du gnas pa nang nam mkha' stong pa ston ka'i ri bong can ltar dkar ba sna tshogs padma dang sna tshogs rdo rjes brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: bha ga zhes pa ni chos 'byung zur gsum gyen du gnas pa nang nam mkha' stong pa ston ka'i ri bong can ltar dkar ba sna tshogs padma dang sna tshogs rdo rjes brgyan pa'o //

original: bsam pa ni bsams nas so //
analyzed: bsam pa ni bsams nas so //
translated: Having contemplated,

original: dbus su bsgom pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dbus su bsgom pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa'o //

original: bya ba ni zhes pa ni bsgom pa pos bya ba'o //üîΩ'khor lo sngon du ci rigs par //üîΩlha rnams ji ltar 'byung ba nyid //
analyzed: bya ba ni zhes pa ni bsgom pa pos bya ba'o // 'khor lo sngon du ci rigs par // lha rnams ji ltar 'byung ba nyid //

original: 'khor lo zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor ro //

original: sngon du zhes pa ni dang po nyid du'o //
analyzed: sngon du zhes pa ni dang po nyid du'o //

original: ci rigs par zhes pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du ste /
translated: As is appropriate means in the proper order.

original: rim pa dang rim pa las bzlog pas so ;
analyzed: rim pa dang rim pa las bzlog pas so ;
translated: In the proper order and in the reverse order.

original: / de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: / de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He says just that:

original: lha rnams ji ltar 'byung ba ni lha rnams rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams ji ltar 'byung ba ni lha rnams rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bskyed pa'o //
translated: The arising of the deities is the generation of the deities in the proper order.

original: 'khor lo nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The wheel itself is said to be:

original: sa dang zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: sa dang zhes pa smos te /
translated: The earth, etc.

original: sa ni dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sa ni dkyil 'khor ro //

original: lam las byung ba mdog ser po gru bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: lam las byung ba mdog ser po gru bzhi pa'o //
translated: It arises from the path, is yellow in color, and has four corners.

original: chu ni chu ste bam las byung ba dkar po zlum po'o //
analyzed: chu ni chu ste bam las byung ba dkar po zlum po'o //
translated: Water is water, which arises from the syllable va·πÉ, is white in color, and is round.

original: re zhig 'di gnyis sngon te dang por ro //
analyzed: re zhig 'di gnyis sngon te dang por ro //
translated: These two are first, i.e., in the beginning.

original: ji ltar rigs pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: As is appropriate is according to the sequence.

original: sa bltas nas de'i steng du chu bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bltas nas de'i steng du chu bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having visualized the earth, one should imagine the water above it.

original: de'i rjes su byin za ram las byung ba mdog dmar po gru gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su byin za ram las byung ba mdog dmar po gru gsum pa'o //
translated: After that, fire arises from the syllable ra·πÉ, is red in color, and is triangular.

original: de ltar sa dang chu dang me'i rang bzhin 'byung ba chen po gsum gyi rang bzhin rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ltar sa dang chu dang me'i rang bzhin 'byung ba chen po gsum gyi rang bzhin rdo rje gsum gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of the three great elements, earth, water, and fire, is the nature of the three vajras.

original: lha rnams ni steng du'o //
analyzed: lha rnams ni steng du'o //
translated: The gods are above.

original: rlung chen ni kun gyi srog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung chen ni kun gyi srog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //

original: yi ge yam las byung ba gzhu'i dbyibs can du ba'i mdog go //
analyzed: yi ge yam las byung ba gzhu'i dbyibs can du ba'i mdog go //

original: de'i steng du sgom pa po sems tsam cig gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i steng du sgom pa po sems tsam cig gi rang bzhin no //
translated: Above that, the meditator is the nature of mind only.

original: 'ang gi sgra ni 'o'i don te /
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra ni 'o'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúand‚Äù.

original: de ltar rim pa 'dis ji @85a * //
analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'dis ji @85a * //
translated: In this way, by this process,üîΩ

original: ltar 'byung zhing rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ltar 'byung zhing rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bskyed pa'o //
translated: In this way, in this order, one should generate the mandala.

original: yang na nam mkha'i khams zhes pa ni //
analyzed: yang na nam mkha'i khams zhes pa ni //
translated: Or else, the element of space

original: dang po stong pa'i byang chub ste //
analyzed: dang po stong pa'i byang chub ste //
translated: is the enlightenment of emptiness in the beginning.

original: zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught.

original: de la bha ga bsam zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la bha ga bsam zhes pa ni /
translated: In that, one should contemplate the bhaga,

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: which is the second, the gathering of the seed.

original: zhes pa gang de yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa gang de yin te /
translated: This is what it is.

original: yi ge ae'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa las chos 'byung du sna tshogs padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rjes brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge ae'i sa bon yongs su gyur pa las chos 'byung du sna tshogs padma dang / sna tshogs rdo rjes brgyan pa'o //
translated: The source of phenomena is the transformation of the seed syllable e, adorned with a variegated lotus and a variegated vajra.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: The nature that was previously taught

original: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni gzugs brnyan rdzogs //
translated: is the third, the perfection of the reflection.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: This is what it is.

original: nang du bcom ldan 'das bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: nang du bcom ldan 'das bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should contemplate the BhagavƒÅn inside.

original: 'khor lo sngon du ci rigs par //
analyzed: 'khor lo sngon du ci rigs par //
translated: The wheels are in the beginning, as appropriate,

original: lha rnams ji ltar 'byung ba nyid //
analyzed: lha rnams ji ltar 'byung ba nyid //
translated: the arising of the deities just as they occur.

original: ces pa'i mthar gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa'i rgyu yang rdzogs pa yin no zhes btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces pa'i mthar gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa'i rgyu yang rdzogs pa yin no zhes btags pa'i phyir /
translated: At the end of this, the cause of the perfection of the reflection is also perfect.

original: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yig 'bru dgod //
translated: The fourth is the arrangement of the syllables.

original: ces pas so //
analyzed: ces pas so //
translated: This is what it is.

original: 'khor lo sa dang chu ni sngon //
analyzed: 'khor lo sa dang chu ni sngon //
translated: The wheel, earth, and water are prior.üîΩAs is appropriate, the wind, the gods, and the great elements,

original: ji ltar rigs par byin za dang // lha rnams dang ni rlung chen dang // ji ltar sgom pa po 'byung ba'ang //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par byin za dang // lha rnams dang ni rlung chen dang // ji ltar sgom pa po 'byung ba'ang //
translated: and also the meditator arise.

original: zhes pa'i mthar 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin pas yi ge dgod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i mthar 'byung ba chen po lnga'i bdag nyid me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo yin pas yi ge dgod pa'o //
translated: At the end of this, the five great elements are the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, such as the mirror, and so on. Since the essence of the utterly pure dharmadhƒÅtu is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, the syllables are placed.

original: yang na 'khor lo gang des sngon du gang de chu'i sngon du ste /
analyzed: yang na 'khor lo gang des sngon du gang de chu'i sngon du ste /
translated: Also, the wheel is prior to that, and water is prior to that.

original: dang por gyur pa'i phyir 'di thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: dang por gyur pa'i phyir 'di thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Since it is the first of all, it is the syllable of all.

original: ji ltar rigs par zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par zhes pa ni /
translated: As is appropriate meansüîΩthat the wind is the appropriate one, and the gods are the appropriate ones.

original: gang de byin za srub pa dang / bsrub pa'i sbyor ba'i rim pas de'i 'byung ba gang nga'o //
analyzed: gang de byin za srub pa dang / bsrub pa'i sbyor ba'i rim pas de'i 'byung ba gang nga'o //
translated: The order of the union of the churning and the churned is the arising of those elements.

original: lha rnams dang ni zhes pa ni gang de rlung chen gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi lha'i rang bzhin te srog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha rnams dang ni zhes pa ni gang de rlung chen gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi lha'i rang bzhin te srog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The gods and so on are all the elements of sentient beings, whose nature is the five aggregates, such as form, and so on, because they are the life force.

original: rlung chen ni ye shes chen po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung chen ni ye shes chen po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The great wind is the nature of great wisdom.üîΩHow does it arise?

original: ji ltar 'byung ba zhes pa ni gang de sgom pa po ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba zhes pa ni gang de sgom pa po ste /
translated: It is the meditator.

original: 'di ltar 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'byung ba ni /
translated: In this way, the elements

original: ji ltar 'byung bas dang chu la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams rnam par shes pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung bas dang chu la sogs pa'i 'byung ba rnams rnam par shes pa la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are dependent on consciousness.

original: de yang 'ang gi sgras nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyis nam mkha'i khams ye shes lnga dang / sku gsum dang thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi 'khor lo yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'ang gi sgras nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyis nam mkha'i khams ye shes lnga dang / sku gsum dang thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid kyi 'khor lo yin no //
translated: And also by the word ‚Äúand‚Äù the element of space, whose nature is space, is the wheel of the five wisdoms, the three bodies, and the nature of method and wisdom.

original: yang na 'khor lo ni mi shes pa gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'khor lo ni mi shes pa gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the wheel is because of the cutting off of ignorance.

original: sa ni chos 'byung bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: sa ni chos 'byung bdag med ma'o //
translated: The earth is the source of phenomena, NairƒÅtmya.

original: chu ni sngon zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: chu ni sngon zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: Water is the prior, that is, the Vajra Holder of the enlightenment spirit.

original: ji ltar @85b rigs pa zhes pa ni rim pa ji lta bar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar @85b rigs pa zhes pa ni rim pa ji lta bar ro //
translated: As is proper is according to the sequence.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i phyir byin za ni gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i phyir byin za ni gnyi ga dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Since both are inseparable, the eater is the nature of the inseparability of both.

original: lha rnams dang ni me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lha rnams dang ni me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The gods are the nature of the five aggregates, such as form, which are the nature of the five pristine awarenesses, such as the mirror-like pristine awareness, and so forth.

original: rlung chen ni ye shes chen po bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyi spro ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung chen ni ye shes chen po bsdu ba'i bdag nyid kyi spro ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The great wind is the nature of the emanation, which is the nature of the collection of the great pristine awareness.

original: yang na sa ni sa sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: yang na sa ni sa sku rdo rje'o //
translated: Alternatively, earth is the earth, that is, the Vajra Body.

original: chu ni byang chub kyi sems n'a da'i bdag nyid gsung rdo rje'o //
analyzed: chu ni byang chub kyi sems n'a da'i bdag nyid gsung rdo rje'o //
translated: Water is the enlightenment spirit, that is, the nature of the speech vajra, which is the nature of the NA DA.

original: byin za zhes pa ni rang bzhin med par byed pa'i phyir thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: byin za zhes pa ni rang bzhin med par byed pa'i phyir thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: The eater is the mind vajra, because it makes the nature of the mind nonexistent.

original: lha ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: lha ni rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The gods are the indivisibility of the three vajras.

original: rlung chen ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rlung chen ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The great wind is the perfect pristine awareness.

original: de yang sgom pa po ni bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: de yang sgom pa po ni bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: The meditator is the Vajra Holder inseparable from NairƒÅtmya.

original: ji ltar ni rim par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ni rim par 'byung ba'o //
translated: How? In sequence.

original: yang na sa dang chu dang byin za rnams kyis dga' ba dang por byas pa'i rnam par dga' bar gyi dga' ba gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na sa dang chu dang byin za rnams kyis dga' ba dang por byas pa'i rnam par dga' bar gyi dga' ba gsum mo //
translated: Or else, the three joys beginning with joy, which are made by the earth, water, and fire energies,

original: rlung chen gyis lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rlung chen gyis lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: and the innate joy made by the great wind energy.

original: sgom pa po zhes pa 'dis bzhi ba'i rang bzhin yongs su rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
analyzed: sgom pa po zhes pa 'dis bzhi ba'i rang bzhin yongs su rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin no //
translated: The meditator is the Vajra Holder who is complete with the nature of the fourth.

original: de nyid / chos 'byung las skyes 'khor lo nyid //
analyzed: de nyid / chos 'byung las skyes 'khor lo nyid //
translated: That itself is the wheel arisen from the source of phenomena.

original: 'phar ma gnyis dag skyon med pa //
analyzed: 'phar ma gnyis dag skyon med pa //
translated: It is the two-storied, faultless

original: chos 'byung gi sgras gzhal yas khang bstan te //
analyzed: chos 'byung gi sgras gzhal yas khang bstan te //
translated: The source of phenomena is taught by the word source of phenomena.

original: chos 'byung las byung ba'i gang 'khor lo de ni 'khor lo chos 'byung las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'byung las byung ba'i gang 'khor lo de ni 'khor lo chos 'byung las byung ba'o //
translated: The wheel that arises from the source of phenomena is the wheel arisen from the source of phenomena.

original: de cis khyad par du 'phags pa gsungs pa /üîΩ'phar ma gnyis so //
analyzed: de cis khyad par du 'phags pa gsungs pa / 'phar ma gnyis so //
translated: How it is superior to that is stated:üîΩIt is the two-storied.

original: 'phar ma gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'phar ma gnyis kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: It has the nature of two stories.

original: dag pa ni yongs su dag pa ste rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i phyir nang gi rim pa dang phyi'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni yongs su dag pa ste rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i phyir nang gi rim pa dang phyi'i rim pa'o //
translated: Pure means completely pure, because of natural purity, the inner and outer stages.

original: skyon med pa ni skyon nang med pa'o //
analyzed: skyon med pa ni skyon nang med pa'o //
translated: Faultless means without inner faults.

original: des ji ltar sdug bsngal bskyed pa ltar phyi rol gyi yul yang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal bskyed pa yin pas skyon dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: des ji ltar sdug bsngal bskyed pa ltar phyi rol gyi yul yang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal bskyed pa yin pas skyon dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Just as it generates suffering, external objects also generate the suffering of the afflictions, and so forth, and so are like faults.

original: de btang nas skyon med pa lha'i bdag nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de btang nas skyon med pa lha'i bdag nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Having abandoned that, the faultless is the nature of the deity, which is the utterly pure nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: ze'u 'bru las ni gcig yin te //
analyzed: ze'u 'bru las ni gcig yin te //
translated: The one is from the stamen,

original: gru gsum gyis ni phyi ma brjod //
analyzed: gru gsum gyis ni phyi ma brjod //
translated: and the latter is expressed by the triangle.

original: ces pa ni rim pa gcig go //
analyzed: ces pa ni rim pa gcig go //
translated: This is the single stage.

original: ze'u 'bru zhes pa ni ze'u 'bru ni padma la rag pa'i phyir padma 'dab ma bzhi par man ngag gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ze'u 'bru zhes pa ni ze'u 'bru ni padma la rag pa'i phyir padma 'dab ma bzhi par man ngag gis shes par bya'o //
translated: The stamen is the lotus, which is known from the instructions to be the four-petaled lotus.

original: gru gsum gyis ni phyi ma zhes pa'i chos 'byung gang khyab pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa gzhan no //
analyzed: gru gsum gyis ni phyi ma zhes pa'i chos 'byung gang khyab pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa gzhan no //
translated: The latter is the other eight-petaled lotus that pervades the dharmodaya, which is expressed by the triangle.

original: de dbus shi ba bco lnga yi //
analyzed: de dbus shi ba bco lnga yi //
translated: In the middle of that, there are fifteen dead bodies.üîΩ

original: gdan gyi bdag nyid rnam par bsam //üîΩzhes pa gang padma gnyis po des @86a * //
analyzed: gdan gyi bdag nyid rnam par bsam // zhes pa gang padma gnyis po des @86a * //
translated: In the middle of that, one should imagine a seat of fifteen corpses.

original: rim pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis so //
translated: The two lotuses are the two stages.

original: de la nang gi rim pa'i lte ba la bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi rim pa'i lte ba la bdag med ma'o //
translated: In that, in the center of the inner stage, is NairƒÅtmya.

original: 'dab ma bzhi la mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma bzhi la mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'o //
translated: On the four petals are the four dakinis.

original: phyi rol gyi 'dab ma brgyad la mkha' 'gro ma brgyad do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'dab ma brgyad la mkha' 'gro ma brgyad do //
translated: On the eight outer petals are the eight dakinis.

original: padma'i 'dab ma gnyi ga'i rtse mo dang rtsa ba'i bar gyi steng 'og dag tu mkha' 'gro ma gnyis so ;
analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma gnyi ga'i rtse mo dang rtsa ba'i bar gyi steng 'og dag tu mkha' 'gro ma gnyis so ;
translated: On the upper and lower parts between the tips and the roots of the two lotus petals are the two dakinis.

original: /'dis ni mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: /'dis ni mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'i rang bzhin gyi 'khor lo rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should complete the wheel, which has the nature of fifteen dakinis.

original: de nas gdan bco lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nas gdan bco lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Then, it is the nature of fifteen seats.

original: bsam pa ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: Imagining is meditation.

original: de yi steng du zla ba yin //
analyzed: de yi steng du zla ba yin //
translated: Above that, there is a moon.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi ro'i gdan bco lnga'o //üîΩde'i steng du zla ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kyi ro'i gdan bco lnga'o // de'i steng du zla ba'o //
translated: The fifteen seats of corpses are the nature of the dharmadhƒÅtu.üîΩAbove that is the moon.

original: zla ba'i steng du sa bon yin //
analyzed: zla ba'i steng du sa bon yin //
translated: Above the moon is the seed.

original: zhes pa ni lha gang bsgom par bya ba de'i sa bon nyid sa bon no //üîΩphyi nas bdud las rgyal bas mnan //üîΩgnyis 'dus pa la bde chen po //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha gang bsgom par bya ba de'i sa bon nyid sa bon no // phyi nas bdud las rgyal bas mnan // gnyis 'dus pa la bde chen po //
translated: The seed is the seed of the deity to be meditated upon.

original: phyi nas ni rjes thogs te de'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: phyi nas ni rjes thogs te de'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: After that, the sun is placed on top of the moon.

original: des sa bon can no //
analyzed: des sa bon can no //
translated: The seed is the seed syllable.

original: mnan pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis mnan pa'o //
analyzed: mnan pa ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis mnan pa'o //
translated: The pressing is the pressing by the sun mandala.

original: de ltar rim pa 'dis nyi ma dang zla ba gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar rim pa 'dis nyi ma dang zla ba gnyis so //
translated: In this way, by this process, there are two, the sun and moon.

original: gang 'dus pa ni de 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'dus pa ni de 'dus pa'o //
translated: The union is the union of those two.

original: de'i bde chen ni ye shes chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i bde chen ni ye shes chen po'o //
translated: The great bliss is the great intuition.

original: 'o na zla ba nyid sa bon gang las yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na zla ba nyid sa bon gang las yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the seed of the moon?

original: zla ba'i sa bon bstan pa /
analyzed: zla ba'i sa bon bstan pa /
translated: The seed of the moon is taught:

original: a'a li zla ba'i gzugs kyis gnas //
analyzed: a'a li zla ba'i gzugs kyis gnas //
translated: The ali resides in the form of the moon.

original: yi ge aa la sogs pa bcu drug po de yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge aa la sogs pa bcu drug po de yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'o //
translated: The moon is the transformation of the sixteen vowels.

original: k'a li'i gzugs kyis snang byed do //
analyzed: k'a li'i gzugs kyis snang byed do //
translated: The kali resides in the form of the sun.

original: zhes pa ni yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bzhi'i n'a da'i phreng ba nyi ma'i gzugs kyis de yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa bzhi'i n'a da'i phreng ba nyi ma'i gzugs kyis de yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'o //
translated: This is the garland of nƒÅda-s of the thirty-four [syllables] beginning with ka in the form of the sun. From that transformation, the sun.

original: rim pa 'dis yongs su rdzogs pa'i zla ba nyi ma 'dus pa las /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis yongs su rdzogs pa'i zla ba nyi ma 'dus pa las /
translated: By this process, the complete moon and sun unite.

original: dkar mo la sogs rab tu grub //
analyzed: dkar mo la sogs rab tu grub //
translated: From that union, the accomplishment of P·πõthivƒ´ and so forth.

original: ces pa ni zla ba nyi ma 'dus pa las ni gang de 'dus pa las so //
analyzed: ces pa ni zla ba nyi ma 'dus pa las ni gang de 'dus pa las so //
translated: This is the union of the moon and sun. From that union.

original: dkar mo la sogs ni phyi rol gyi rim par 'du byed nas bdag med ma la thug pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams bsdu bas so //
analyzed: dkar mo la sogs ni phyi rol gyi rim par 'du byed nas bdag med ma la thug pa'i mkha' 'gro ma rnams bsdu bas so //
translated: P·πõthivƒ´ and so forth are the outer circle, beginning with P·πõthivƒ´ and ending with NairƒÅtmya, the gathering of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´-s.

original: grub ces pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: grub ces pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment is complete.

original: de ltar gnyi ga'i n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis 'dus nas yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i nyi zla gnyis kyi nang du son pa'i sa bon las byung ba'i mkha' 'gro ma ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga'i n'a da'i phreng ba gnyis 'dus nas yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i nyi zla gnyis kyi nang du son pa'i sa bon las byung ba'i mkha' 'gro ma ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the two garlands of nƒÅda-s of both [the moon and sun] unite and transform into the two sun and moon that arise from the seed syllable located in the middle. In order to teach that the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´-s are the nature of the five gnoses, it is said:

original: zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
analyzed: zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
translated: The moon is endowed with mirror-like gnosis.

original: zhes pa ste gang 'di a'a li'i n'a da'i phreng ba yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste gang 'di a'a li'i n'a da'i phreng ba yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'o //
translated: This is the moon, which is the transformation of the garland of AlikAli phonemes.

original: de yang me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin @86b rnam par snang mdzad kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: de yang me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin @86b rnam par snang mdzad kun du snang ba'i mtshan nyid sku rdo rje sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: And that is the mirror-like intuition, the nature of Vairochana, the body vajra, the beatific body.

original: bdun pa'i bdun pa mnyam nyid ldan //
analyzed: bdun pa'i bdun pa mnyam nyid ldan //
translated: The seventh of the seventh is endowed with uniformity.üîΩThe seventh of the seventh is the letter S, which is the seed of Amoghasiddhi.

original: mnyam pa nyid gnyis su med pa nyid du rtog pa yod pa 'di'i phyir na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid gnyis su med pa nyid du rtog pa yod pa 'di'i phyir na /
translated: Since it is the conception of non-duality as uniformity,

original: mnyam pa nyid ldan pa rin chen 'byung ldan yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin thugs rdo rje rang bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ldan pa rin chen 'byung ldan yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin thugs rdo rje rang bzhin med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos kyi sku'o //
translated: it is endowed with uniformity, which is the nature of Ratnasa·πÉbhava, the mind vajra, the reality nature of correct intuitive wisdom, the reality nature of essencelessness, the reality body.

original: rang lha'i sa bon phyag mtshan ni //
analyzed: rang lha'i sa bon phyag mtshan ni //
translated: The seed and insignia of one's deity.üîΩThe seed and insignia of one's deity is the seed of whatever it is, the seed of that.

original: gang dang gang gi sa bon gang yin pa de dang de'i sa bon yin pas sa bon dang lha'i phyag mtshan gang de ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi sa bon gang yin pa de dang de'i sa bon yin pas sa bon dang lha'i phyag mtshan gang de ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Whatever the seed and insignia of the deity, that is the discriminating intuition.

original: dngos po mtha' dag phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i sa bon n'a da'i rang bzhin gyis gsung rdo rje longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: dngos po mtha' dag phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i sa bon n'a da'i rang bzhin gyis gsung rdo rje longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The nature of the seed of the unerring realization of all things is the Enjoyment Body of the Speech-Vajra.

original: de nyid brjod par bya ba ni bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod par bya ba ni bstan par bya'o //
translated: That should be expressed, should be taught.

original: thams cad gcig gyur nan tan nyid //
analyzed: thams cad gcig gyur nan tan nyid //
translated: The reality of all things is the practice of the one.

original: rdzogs pa chos nyid dag pa ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa chos nyid dag pa ste /
translated: The perfection is the purity of reality.

original: thams cad ces pa ni rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: thams cad ces pa ni rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: All things are the three vajras.

original: gcig gyur ni gcig cing tha mi dad par gyur pa gang de'o //
analyzed: gcig gyur ni gcig cing tha mi dad par gyur pa gang de'o //
translated: The one is the one which is not different.

original: chos nyid dag pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos nyid dag pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid yin te /
translated: The purity of reality is the reality of complete purity.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the completely pure realm of reality.

original: de'i nan tan ni rjes su 'dra bar mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas par ro //
analyzed: de'i nan tan ni rjes su 'dra bar mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas par ro //
translated: The practice of that is the abiding in the equality of the similar subsequent.

original: chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The realm of reality is the non-conceptual intuition of thusness.

original: de la zla ba dang nyi ma gnyis thabs dang shes rab dag go //
analyzed: de la zla ba dang nyi ma gnyis thabs dang shes rab dag go //
translated: The two, moon and sun, are the method and wisdom.

original: de'i nang du sa bon dang lhan cig dbyer med pa'i rdo rje gsum gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa'i bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings nyid du rnam par gzhag pa me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: de'i nang du sa bon dang lhan cig dbyer med pa'i rdo rje gsum gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa'i bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings nyid du rnam par gzhag pa me long la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga'o //
translated: In it, the five intuitions mirrorlike and so on are established as the utterly pure reality realm, the fourth simultaneously born, inseparable from the seed and the three vajras, the perfect image.

original: yang na chos 'byung ni bdag med ma don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chos 'byung ni bdag med ma don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Or else, the reality realm is NairƒÅtmya, ultimate reality.

original: de las skyes ni rab tu gsal bar byung ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de las skyes ni rab tu gsal bar byung ba kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Born from that is the relative reality, arisen as clear light.

original: gnyi ga dbyer med pa gang de ni chos 'byung las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dbyer med pa gang de ni chos 'byung las skyes pa'o //
translated: That which is the inseparability of the two is born from the reality realm.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de 'khor lo nyid de mi shes pa mtha' dag gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'khor lo nyid de mi shes pa mtha' dag gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: It is a wheel, because it cuts through all ignorance.

original: bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bdag med ma dang dbyer med pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is the intuition of Vajradhara, inseparable from NairƒÅtmya.

original: de nyid 'phar ma gnyis te gnyi ga yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'phar ma gnyis te gnyi ga yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is a double-decker, because of the union of the two.

original: dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure, because of natural purity.

original: skyon med pa ni ma rig pa gdug pa'i sems rnams kyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par yun ring por goms par byas pas der 'dzin pa log pa'i rtog pas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam @87a * //üîΩpar dag pa'i rang bzhin nyid du brtags nas /
analyzed: skyon med pa ni ma rig pa gdug pa'i sems rnams kyis rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par yun ring por goms par byas pas der 'dzin pa log pa'i rtog pas chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam @87a * // par dag pa'i rang bzhin nyid du brtags nas /
translated: The faultless is the nature of the extremely pure dharmadhatu, which is imagined by the conceptualization of the opposite of grasping, through long-term, constant habituation with the poisonous mind of ignorance.üîΩ

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ma lus par nyams su myong ba'i sdug bsngal skyed par byed pas na skyon dang 'dra bas na skyon no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags ma lus par nyams su myong ba'i sdug bsngal skyed par byed pas na skyon dang 'dra bas na skyon no //
translated: The faultless is so called because it is similar to a fault, since it generates the experience of the suffering of the complete destruction of the latent imprints of the afflictions.

original: de nas lha'i rnam par dag pas spangs nas sems pas na skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: de nas lha'i rnam par dag pas spangs nas sems pas na skyon med pa'o //
translated: Then, since it is contemplated by the purity of the deity, it is faultless.

original: 'dis ni nang rim gyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni nang rim gyis dag pa'o //
translated: This is the inner purity in stages.

original: phyi rol gyi skyon med pa dang phyi dang nang dbyer med pa nyid de ye shes yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi skyon med pa dang phyi dang nang dbyer med pa nyid de ye shes yin no //
translated: The external faultlessness and the indivisibility of the external and internal are the pristine consciousness.

original: de la gcig ni gnyis med pa'o //
analyzed: de la gcig ni gnyis med pa'o //
translated: Among those, one is nondual.

original: ze'u 'bru las ni mtha' yas pa mu med pa'i rdul phra rab bsags pa'i rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad ni gcig cing dbyer med par rtogs pa'i phyir aa shes rab po //
analyzed: ze'u 'bru las ni mtha' yas pa mu med pa'i rdul phra rab bsags pa'i rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad ni gcig cing dbyer med par rtogs pa'i phyir aa shes rab po //
translated: The anthers are the nature of all things, which are one and indivisible, because they are the accumulation of infinite, limitless subtle particles.

original: ka bde ba thabs so //
analyzed: ka bde ba thabs so //
translated: Ka is bliss, the means.

original: re re yang thabs dang shes rab dbyer med par 'byung ngo //üîΩde nyid zur gsum ste zur gsum ni rdo rje zur gsum ste /
analyzed: re re yang thabs dang shes rab dbyer med par 'byung ngo // de nyid zur gsum ste zur gsum ni rdo rje zur gsum ste /
translated: Each of them arises as the indivisible union of means and wisdom.üîΩThat itself is the three corners, and the three corners are the three corners of the vajra.

original: zur gsum po des na rdo rje gsum mo //
analyzed: zur gsum po des na rdo rje gsum mo //
translated: By those three corners, there are three vajras.

original: phyi ma ni bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni bzhi pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The latter is the fourth, connate.

original: de yang brjod ni yang dag pa'i ye shes nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang brjod ni yang dag pa'i ye shes nyid yin no //
translated: That also is the expression, which is the nature of utterly pure pristine consciousness.

original: de dbus ro ni bsam bya ba //
analyzed: de dbus ro ni bsam bya ba //
translated: The taste in the middle should be contemplated.

original: zhes pa ni de ni ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ni ye shes so //
translated: That is pristine consciousness.

original: dbus ni dbu ma'i mtha'o //
analyzed: dbus ni dbu ma'i mtha'o //
translated: The middle is the end of the middle.

original: bsam bya ba ni rtog pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bsam bya ba ni rtog pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Contemplated is the arrangement by the aspect of imagination.

original: de yang ro ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de yang ro ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin bdag med ma dang tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Moreover, the corpse is the gnosis of Vajradhara, inseparable from Nairatmya, whose nature is the conventional truth, which has the nature of the ultimate realm.

original: yul dang dbang po des bskyed pa'i shes pas bco lnga'o //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po des bskyed pa'i shes pas bco lnga'o //
translated: The objects and faculties and the consciousnesses produced by them make fifteen.

original: de rnams kyi gdan ni tha mal pa spong ba ste bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gdan ni tha mal pa spong ba ste bsdu ba'o //
translated: Their seat is the abandonment of the ordinary, that is, the collection.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni de'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa dang dbyer med pa'i bdag med ma'i ye shes so //
translated: Its nature is the gnosis of Nairatmya, inseparable from Vajradhara.

original: de'i steng du ni don yod pa sku rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du ni don yod pa sku rdo rje'o //
translated: On top of that is Amoghasiddhi, the vajra body.

original: sa byang chub kyi sems thugs rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sa byang chub kyi sems thugs rdo rje'o //
translated: Earth is the mind of enlightenment, the vajra mind.

original: yo rlung gsung rdo rje ste rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yo rlung gsung rdo rje ste rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Water is the speech vajra, the wind. The gnosis is the inseparability of the three vajras.

original: de ltar de'i steng du'o //
analyzed: de ltar de'i steng du'o //
translated: Thus, on top of that.

original: de yongs su gyur pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens through its transformation?

original: zla ba ste bco lnga'i cha'i bdag nyid can gyi byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: zla ba ste bco lnga'i cha'i bdag nyid can gyi byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The moon is the mind of enlightenment, which has the nature of the fifteen parts.

original: zla ba'i steng du sa bon nyid //
analyzed: zla ba'i steng du sa bon nyid //
translated: On top of the moon, the seed itself.

original: ces pa ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su gyur pa nyid khams gsum gyi sa bon gyi rang bzhin can yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ces pa ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su gyur pa nyid khams gsum gyi sa bon gyi rang bzhin can yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: This is the perfectly pure intuition which is the seed nature of the three realms, and is the transformation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: 'dis ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ye shes te rnam par ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin dga' ba zhes bya ba'i ye shes te rnam par ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the intuition called Joy, which is the nature of Vairocana, and is the determination.

original: snang mdzad ni bde ba'i ye shes gsal bar byed pa 'dis na'o //
analyzed: snang mdzad ni bde ba'i ye shes gsal bar byed pa 'dis na'o //
translated: Vairocana is the intuition of bliss, which is the illumination of this.

original: de bas na dga' ba lhag pa mchog tu dga' ba'i rang @87b bzhin de rgyas par byed pas rin chen no //
analyzed: de bas na dga' ba lhag pa mchog tu dga' ba'i rang @87b bzhin de rgyas par byed pas rin chen no //
translated: Therefore, the jewel is the expansion of that nature of supreme joy, which is the excess of joy.

original: de'i gtso bo ni mnga' bdag go //
analyzed: de'i gtso bo ni mnga' bdag go //
translated: The lord is the chief of that.

original: rgyu de'i phyir bzod par nus pa'i phyir 'od dpag med de /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir bzod par nus pa'i phyir 'od dpag med de /
translated: For that reason, it is possible to endure, and so it is Amitabha.

original: dpag med ni dpag tu med pa yin la /
analyzed: dpag med ni dpag tu med pa yin la /
translated: AmitƒÅbha is immeasurable, and

original: 'od ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams ma rig pa las ldog pa gang la yod pa de ni 'od dpag tu med ba rnam par dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'od ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams ma rig pa las ldog pa gang la yod pa de ni 'od dpag tu med ba rnam par dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the light is the object, sense-faculty, and consciousnesses, which have the reversal of ignorance. He who has that is AmitƒÅbha, the nature of the complete joy.

original: de ltar rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa de yongs su gyur pa'i gang byang chub kyi sems de dbyer med pa'i ye shes nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje gsum dbyer med pa de yongs su gyur pa'i gang byang chub kyi sems de dbyer med pa'i ye shes nyid yang dag pa'i ye shes yin no //
translated: Thus, that bodhicitta, which is the complete transformation of the inseparability of the three vajras, is the perfect pristine consciousness.

original: de yi steng du zla ba yin //
analyzed: de yi steng du zla ba yin //
translated: On top of that is the moon.

original: zla ba'i steng du sa bon nyid //
analyzed: zla ba'i steng du sa bon nyid //
translated: On top of the moon is the seed.

original: ces pa'o // phyi nas zhes pa ni rjes thogs nyid du ste bar ma chod pa nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ces pa'o // phyi nas zhes pa ni rjes thogs nyid du ste bar ma chod pa nyid kyis de'i bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: After means immediately after, without interruption, by the very nature of that.

original: nyi mas ni chags pa kun spangs pa'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: nyi mas ni chags pa kun spangs pa'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The sun is the innate nature that abandons all attachment.

original: kun du mnan ni de rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun du mnan ni de rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is pressed down, which is the realization of that.

original: gnyis 'dus pa ni khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa dag dbyer med du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis 'dus pa ni khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa dag dbyer med du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The union of the two is the realization of the inseparability of the seminal fluid and the innate.

original: bde chen po ni ye shes chen po'o //
analyzed: bde chen po ni ye shes chen po'o //
translated: Great bliss is great pristine consciousness.

original: de nyid a'a li gnas ni bde chen a'a li mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de nyid a'a li gnas ni bde chen a'a li mkha' 'gro ma bco lnga'o //
translated: That itself is the abode of ƒÅlƒ´, which is the abode of the fifteen ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s of the ƒÅlƒ´ of great bliss.

original: de gnas pa ni mi g-yo bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de gnas pa ni mi g-yo bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Abiding there is becoming immovable.

original: ci zhe na zla ba'i gzugs kyis te khu ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: ci zhe na zla ba'i gzugs kyis te khu ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: What is it? It is the form of the moon, which is the nature of the seminal fluid.

original: k'a li'i gzugs kyis ni ka ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: k'a li'i gzugs kyis ni ka ni bde ba'o //
translated: In the form of Kali, the syllable ka is bliss.

original: de'i a'a li'i phreng ba dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bar du k'a li'o //
analyzed: de'i a'a li'i phreng ba dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bar du k'a li'o //
translated: Its garland of ali is the kalila, from the joy of the first stage up to the innate joy.

original: de'i gzugs kyis ni de'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de'i gzugs kyis ni de'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: In its form is by its nature.

original: snang byed ni 'od gsal zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snang byed ni 'od gsal zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Illuminator is the meaning of clear light.

original: 'dir zla ba dang nyi ma gnyis khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin ngag go //
analyzed: 'dir zla ba dang nyi ma gnyis khu ba dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin ngag go //
translated: Here, the two, moon and sun, are the innate joy together with the seminal essence.

original: gang 'dus pa ni dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'dus pa ni dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The union is the indivisibility.

original: de ni / dkar mo la sogs rab tu grub //
analyzed: de ni / dkar mo la sogs rab tu grub //
translated: That is the accomplishment of Gaurƒ´ and so forth.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa nyid kyi bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi ye shes yin par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor gnyis dbyer med pa nyid kyi bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi ye shes yin par gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the two mandalas are the indivisible nature of the two truths, the nature of gnosis, it is said.

original: zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
analyzed: zla ba me long ye shes ldan //
translated: The moon is endowed with mirror-like gnosis.

original: zhes pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes pa smos te /
translated: This is said.

original: 'od gsal gyi ye shes dang dbyer med pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi ye shes dang dbyer med pa nyid kyi byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The clear light gnosis is indivisible from the bodhicitta.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang 'od gsal ba dag dbyer med du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang 'od gsal ba dag dbyer med du rtogs pa'o //
translated: Equality is the realization of the indivisibility of the bodhicitta and the clear light.

original: bdun pa'i bdun pa ni /
analyzed: bdun pa'i bdun pa ni /
translated: The seventh of the seventh

original: nyi ma ste rin chen gtso bo'o //
analyzed: nyi ma ste rin chen gtso bo'o //
translated: is the sun, the chief of the jewels.

original: 'dir de snyed kyi lhan cig skyes pa dang dbyer med pa nyid kyi khu ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir de snyed kyi lhan cig skyes pa dang dbyer med pa nyid kyi khu ba'o //
translated: Here, that much is the semen, which is inseparable from the innate.

original: de bas na sa bon ni dga' ba la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bas na sa bon ni dga' ba la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Therefore, the seed is the joys, etc.

original: rang lha'i ni rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: rang lha'i ni rang rig pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi ye shes so //
translated: Of one's deity is the gnosis characterized by self-awareness.

original: phyag mtshan ni mtshan @88a * //
analyzed: phyag mtshan ni mtshan @88a * //
translated: The insignia is the sign.

original: ma'o ; / de nyid so sor rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ma'o ; / de nyid so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: That itself is discernment,

original: so so re re zhing rtog pa med par nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: so so re re zhing rtog pa med par nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the experience of each and every one.

original: rjod par byed pa ni gsal bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ni gsal bar bya ba'o //

original: de nas yang thams cad ni dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa la thug par ro //
analyzed: de nas yang thams cad ni dga' ba la sogs pa lhan cig skyes pa la thug par ro //
translated: Then, again, all is from the joys, etc., up to the innate.

original: gcig gyur ni gcig cing dbyer med par gyur pa gang ngo //

original: de ni nan tan te 'dra ba nyid du gnas pa'o //
